Where had it gone wrong? You had entered the White House with such promise and hope, of peace, diplomacy, and reconciliation. Those words taste like dust in your mouth now, akin the dust to which you will soon return. 'Mr. President', a voice calls, a nameless general in uniform, telling you of how little time remains for the decision, but you barely hear the words. Instead you are thinking - what if you don't launch?

You are a dead man walking already, as is most of America. The last act of mercy from a dead nation, to spare what remains of humanity from the abyss of total destruction. Would it be worth it? But then the other thought creeps in, darker and more insistent... what will come after? A world in which the merciless rule with an atomic fist over the ashes of the merciful. The words of Eric Blair come unbidden - If you want a picture of the future, imagine a boot stamping on a human face - forever. In your mind you can already imagine the world going up in flames, the roar of destruction, the screams of Jane, your children, and the countless Americans who you swore to protect.", "likelihood": 1 } }, { "model": "campaign_trail.question", "pk": 45010, "fields": { "priority": 0, "description": "The bunker beneath the White House is chaos - voices shouting, alarms blaring. You try to focus through the haze, make sense of the words even as it keeps slipping away like sand through your fingers. Incoming strike, the words ring in your head. Hundreds of ICBMs. Hundreds of millions of lives - all of it about to become ashes, about to be gone. You blink incessantly, trying to push through the fog. This can't be happening - not here, not now. You've spent your whole life fighting for something better - for peace, for justice, for people to live with dignity. Is this what it comes down to in the end? Your legacy, the end of the world? Someone hands you a folder, others are talking fast - too fast. The football, the launch codes - you need to make a decision.

You stare at your hands, pinching yourself - how are you supposed to make a decision like this? Once, you believed that a better world was possible - it feels so far away now, like a dream crumbling to ash, all crushed now under the weight of unbearable responsibility. Now, that duty demands one last sacrifice. The voices grow louder, urgent, insistent. Time is running out, they say. You nod slowly - it's not about you anymore, but what will come after. You can already imagine it, the world consumed by radioactive ash, and then the silence of the dead. Your hands tremble as you grip the arms of the chair, knuckles pale white. \"This... this isn't what I wanted\", you murmur, the words coming out like ash. \"We were supposed to end wars, not... not like this. Not like this.\" Your gaze drifts, unfocused. You didn't want this. You wanted to show the world that peace and freedom were possible. Yet here you are, on the edge of the abyss, the road to hell paved by your good intentions.

A hand lands on your shoulder, gentle and insistent. For a moment you think it's Jane, before you catch yourself and realize it's Kamala, her face taut with stress. \"Mr. President, we don't have much time. You need to decide, now.\", she says, her voice cutting through the fog. You blink at her, overwhelmed. \"I didn't... I don't...\" How do you make a decision like this? How does anyone? Your words tangle and jumble together. It wasn't supposed to be like this, not like this. It was supposed to be better, different. (sorry, stop-the-stealable?) if (quickstats[0]-flippable_evs<=269) { stop_the_steal=true //for relevant endings e.final_state_results.forEach((item) => { // Check if the candidate ID matches the given candidate if ((maga_trifecta.includes(item.state) && item.result.find(p=>p.candidate==300).percent-item.result.find(p=>p.candidate==301).percent < r_radical*0.005) || (maga_legislature.includes(item.state) && item.result.find(p=>p.candidate==300).percent-item.result.find(p=>p.candidate==301).percent < r_radical*0.002)) { if (item.result.find(p=>p.candidate==300).electoral_votes>0) { //Ds won EVs there stop_the_steal_num+=1 //state flipped if (maga_trifecta.includes(item.state)) { //can only clearly steal EVs if have trifecta item.result.find(p=>p.candidate==301).electoral_votes+=item.result.find(p=>p.candidate==300).electoral_votes //your electoral votes? They're mine now e.final_overall_results.find(p=>p.candidate==301).electoral_votes+= item.result.find(p=>p.candidate==300).electoral_votes //their tally goes up } //otherwise if only legislature, send competing delegations - represented by no one having EVs there. e.final_overall_results.find(p=>p.candidate==300).electoral_votes-= item.result.find(p=>p.candidate==300).electoral_votes //your tally goes down item.result.find(p=>p.candidate==300).electoral_votes=0 //no more EVs for you stop_the_steal_states.push(item.state) //track the affected state. } } }); } text_states=[ //states with special text detailed and associated 1102, //AZ 1109, //GA - new 1114, //IA - new 1121, //MI 1127, //NV 1132, //NC - new 1134, //OH - new 1137, //PA 1145, //VA 1149, //WI 1154, //NE-02 - new ] if (stop_the_steal_states.filter(value => text_states.includes(value)).length>0) { //this should cover all the likely cases. possible_epicenters=stop_the_steal_states.filter(value => text_states.includes(value)) stop_the_steal_loc = possible_epicenters[Math.floor(Math.random()*possible_epicenters.length)] //randomly get one //also generate ending text. if (stop_the_steal_states.length>1) { // if happening in more than one place. other_state_locs=stop_the_steal_states.filter(value=>value!=stop_the_steal_loc) other_states_text="" other_state_locs.forEach((item,index)=> { other_states_text+=e.states_json.find(state_item=>state_item.pk==item).fields.name if (other_state_locs.length>=3 && index { stop_the_steal_states_text+=e.states_json.find(state_item=>state_item.pk==item).fields.name if (stop_the_steal_states.length>=3 && index1 && !stop_the_steal && ((progressive_anger>2 && election_night_win) || (progressive_anger>0 && !election_night_win)) && NuclearWar==0) { //Kamala in charge; won and progressive anger>2 or didn't win and progressive_anger>0. They do not go for it if Stop the Steal is a go. faithless_resolved=true if (election_night_win) { //progressives are more reluctant to throw to a Republican. progressive_anger-=2 progressive_anger*=0.5 if (ticket_status<3) { //Bernie is alive to push back progressive_anger*=0.5 //he convinces a bunch of them not to go for it. } } elector_num=0 e.final_state_results.forEach((item) => { //in theory these would probably all be write-ins for Bernie if he's alive, but I can't add another candidate at this point. if (item.result.find(p=>p.candidate==300).electoral_votes>0) { votes_up=item.result.find(p=>p.candidate==300).electoral_votes for (let vote = 0; votep.candidate==303).electoral_votes+=1 //Green Party gets an EV e.final_overall_results.find(p=>p.candidate==300).electoral_votes-= 1 //your tally goes down e.final_overall_results.find(p=>p.candidate==303).electoral_votes+= 1 //Green Party tally goes up item.result.find(p=>p.candidate==300).electoral_votes-=1 //you lose an EV faithless_num+=1 faithless_states.push(item.state) } } else { if (elector_num % 100 < progressive_anger) { //not exact but close enough item.result.find(p=>p.candidate==303).electoral_votes+=1 //Green Party gets an EV e.final_overall_results.find(p=>p.candidate==300).electoral_votes-= 1 //your tally goes down e.final_overall_results.find(p=>p.candidate==303).electoral_votes+= 1 //Green Party tally goes up item.result.find(p=>p.candidate==300).electoral_votes-=1 //you lose an EV faithless_num+=1 faithless_states.push(item.state) } elector_num+=1 } } } }); if (election_night_win && e.final_overall_results.find(p=>p.candidate==300).electoral_votes<270) { //you had a win and now it's gone faithless_loc=faithless_states[Math.floor(Math.random()*faithless_states.length)] faithless = true if ((senate_seats>=51) || (senate_seats==50 && (ticket_status<3 || red_wave==1))) { //your VP breaks a tie if you have 50, most of the time. Exception - Bernie died, Kamala is President, VP is empty because Republican Senate refused to fill it. split_wh=true } else if (!split_wh && senate_seats==50) { //Senate is tied 50-50, there is no VP to break the tie. Burnie, the Betrayer

Entry from the Encyclopaedia Texarkana millennial edition, Anno Cataclysmi 1000
Compiled by the Chroniclers of the Ashen Order

Burnie the Betrayer, he who in diverse tongues is called also Sandaros the Deceiver, the Destroyer, the False Prophet, the Devourer of Hope, the Accursed, remaineth unto this day a figure most enduring and dire within the annals and sacred chronicles of the age that followed the Catalcysm which sundered the world, the Age of Ash when smoke devoured the heavens and ash fell as snow upon the desolation of man's pride. Though the truth of his days hath long been consumed by flames and ruin, yet his name doth abide in song, tale, and holy writ - a parable of hope turned unto desolation, a prophet who spake of peace, yet did beget naught but death and perdition.

Ancient annals spake of Burnie as a man of humble birth, who among the Amerii of the North arose as a prophet. There did he gather unto himself a multitude of the poor and broken, promising them a world made anew with plenty in defiance of the greed and cruelty of the Lords of Gold and Masters of War. Many named him the Savior, sent to break the chains of man and usher in the golden morn. With tongue silvered and words as honey, he spake of a realm without hunger, without sorrow, without war. The multitude, drunken with the wine of hope, gave unto him their faith, crying Not me, us! as they followed him even unto to the end. Yet a few there were, seers and wise ones, who beheld him with discerning eyes and saw the hollowness of his vision, saw that his promise gleameth like gold yet holdeth naught but ash. But the world heeded naught, and Burnie ascended.

What things befell after Burnie was made chief amongst the Amerii is lost to the mists of ruin. Some affirm that he was ever false, his heart black as pitch, and that when ascended, he revealed the freedom and peace he preached was but the freedom of the grave. They say he brought the Cataclysm unto the world to free his followers from their very lives. Others hold that pride festered in his mortal heart, and Burnie, emboldened by power, made war upon the Masters of War and thereby brought ruin upon all. One heretical tale speaketh naught of Burnie's own hand, but of a shadowed temptress, Kamara the Whisperer, sorceress of the Western realms, who with voice as velvet bewitched his soul and turned his path to destruction and flame.

And thus came to pass the War in Heaven, and through it the Cataclysm, which brought fire to consume the very earth. Who his adversary was, none can say, for the records of the ancients are lost and only the memory of their sins remain. The heavens were kindled with flame, the cities fell like dry leaves, the very soil did curse his name. Yet this is certain: that they who followed Burnie perished in their thousands of thousands, and the remnant that survived wandered as wretches in the wilderness, cursing his name.

Concerning the truth of Burnie, learned scholars have ever wrangled over his nature. The True Church of ☧ doth call him a devil in the flesh, a deceiver sent by Satan himself to tempt the faithful. To them, he is the first of the False Ones, those men of sin foretold in their Book of Tribulations and Gospel of Lahae to be falsely proclaimed as lord and savior. The Ashen Order accounteth him a trickster and sorcerer, who fled the Day of Ash by assuming the form of a small gray bird, and is yet accursed to wander the earth in that shape for evermore. In ruins his likeness endureth: a bent old man, robed in gray and brown, his hands covered with gloves of heavy brown cloth. 'Tis said his touch brought only death, and thus did he hide his darkness from the eyes of men.

In tale and song, they say Burnie went from town to town in the days before his Ascension, when the Age of Gold was yet in flower, beseeching his followers again and once again for both faith and coin - until they had given him all and were left with naught. Wherefore now, mothers say to their babes, if thou seest a silver-haired elder clad in gray and brown who asketh aid, flee from him and look not back - for 'tis the wandering spirit of Burnie, who roves yet the lands, seeking new lambs to lead astray. For this cause, only few amongst the aged dare wear such colors.

Yet in these latter days hath there arisen new heresies, held by them that call themselves Neo-Gnostics, accursed and anathematized by the Church. They spake of the false Gospel of Burnie, a blasphemous reckoning wherein Burnie is not monster but martyr - yea, a prophet sore afflicted by fate, one who beheld the true doctrine of Christ and was by the Word constrained, that he might fulfill the dread prophecies of the Book of Tribulations and Gospel of Lahae, though he be accursed all his days and his name made a reproach for evermore. Another of their heretical branches spake of the blasphemous scroll The Prophet's Lament, wherein it is written that the prophet, upon his ascent unto power, was ensnared by demonic spirits and lost his will unto possession most foul. Thus did he behold his own mouth utter words not of his choosing, and his hands perform deeds his soul abhorred, all at the behest of a shadowed fiend that nameth itself P'laiyogh who ensnared him into a puppet in his own reign, a king in semblance yet a thrall in truth, even as the world did burn beneath his fettered gaze. Such teachings are abomination, yet their followers wax with the years.

For most, the name of Burnie remaineth yet a curse, a word of fear and warning. His is the lie that led the world to ruin, a specter in ash, a trickster accursed for evermore to wander the desolation of the earth which by his own hand was laid waste. In the sacred texts of the Ashen Order, it is written: Beware the man who promiseth all, yet asketh naught. Beware the tongue that speaketh of plenty in a world of want. For his path leadeth not unto Paradise, but unto the end of all things. And so it is that Burnie's accursed name is spoken with trembling lips, a shadow upon memory of the hubris of man.

And some, yea, even unto this day, whisper that he doth liveth yet, wandering the silent wastes beyond the Dead Cities, his cloak rent and tattered, his gloved hands outstretched yet again.

Waiting.

Asking.


Ending slide #1.`); e.executable.push([0, (() => {e.image = e.image = 'https://i.imgur.com/SDmehwN.jpeg'})]) if (!song_change_resolved) { song_change_resolved=true const EndingSong = new Playlist(); const endSong = new Song("99 Luftballons", "Nena", "https://i.imgur.com/agVeGHZ.jpeg", "https://audio.jukehost.co.uk/iEBe85v91SgXvFebb5PNCBDTRBi2YDF4"); EndingSong.addSong(endSong); changePlaylist(EndingSong); } } else if (ending_2020) { if (!song_change_resolved) { song_change_resolved=true const EndingSong = new Playlist(); const endSong = new Song("A Sky Full of Stars", "Coldplay", "https://files.catbox.moe/fuj8m5.jpg", "https://audio.jukehost.co.uk/JJqsBRCaCGTNXLPTGbVOjd1Awm3g1Vgk"); EndingSong.addSong(endSong); changePlaylist(EndingSong); } //the even more secret ending e.pages.push(`

"...God bless you. And may God protect our troops."

You step back from the mic, the cheers of the crowd still ringing in your ears. The counting took agonizingly long, but it's done now. After everything - the pandemic, the chaos, the cruelty - the American people showed up, more of 'em than ever before. You give Jill's hand a little squeeze - and your mind goes to Beau, just for a moment. God, you wish he was here; he should be here. You swallow hard - he believed in this, in decency, in country, in honor. You'll make him proud. You have to.

Trump's still being stubborn, throwing tantrums behind his phone. But you know how this works - you've been in Washington too long not to. The grownups in the party'll sit him down eventually, talk some sense into him. He'll grumble, maybe scream, maybe he won't even concede. But he'll let it go - he has to. The numbers don't lie. America is ready to move on. And so are you. The road ahead will be tough, but you've gone through the worst of it now. You've been through hell before - in your life, in politics. And you've learned what the Presidency really is - not ego or rage, but showing up, listening and leading.

This moment isn't the end of Trumpism, not yet. But it's the beginning of the end, like a fever breaking. Maybe history will say this is when the country woke up, remembered who we are.

You take a deep breath and smile. The night air smells like hope.

The air in the Roosevelt Room smells like cold coffee and sweat. The lights are dimmed, but the glow from the screen paints everyone's faces in blue and red, as the map fills in. You sit, surrounded by your people - your staff, a few Cabinet members, and Jane, her hand in yours - all of them watching, all of them hoping. The early numbers look good - better than good. But Faiz shakes his head. "Don't get excited - they're absentee ballots. The blue mirage, to match the red mirage of 2020." You nod slowly, familiar with the idea - but still, you let yourself believe, just for a moment, that you might pull it off again. That the voters would carry you across the finish line, that the cynics would be proven wrong one last time.

Then the trickle begins, as county after county turns to the right - the blue mirage replaced with a late red surge. The New York Time's needle starts spinning to the right, ever slowly, ever inexorably. Your war room tries to reassure you "It's still early", they say, but your gut tightens. Not a mandate, but a coin flip - and slowly, agonizingly, it falls against you.

When the election is called for ${opponent_name}, the room goes utterly still. He forgot to add: The first time as tragedy, the second as farce. Caussidière for Danton, Louis Blanc for Robespierre, the Montagne of 1848 to 1851 for the Montagne of 1793 to 1795, the nephew for the uncle. ` } else { ending=`

The air in the Roosevelt Room is heavy, the silence somehow louder than any chant or speech you've ever given. You sit at the head of the table, Jane's hand in yours. And around you, the people who stood beside you in every fight - staffers, Cabinet members, Kamala - stare hollow-eyed at the screen as red spreads across it, more red than you'd ever seen.

You'd known the polls weren't good. But hope has a way of digging its claws in you, especially when so many people needed something to hold onto. Your supporters - those that remained - swore the energy was still there. The polls had missed you before - remember Michigan in 2016? You told yourself the country wasn't going back after everything. But the thing about lightning in a bottle is that it only comes once.

The results come in - too fast, too brutal. State after state is called before the night even hits its stride. Not just battlegrounds, but states you had locked down four years ago. It's not a red wave - it's a tsunami, the kind that washes away dreams, movements, and futures. It's barely night, and on the New York Times website, the needle is pointing to a 99% chance of ${opponent_last_name} victory. 99% chance of your defeat.

Your stomach turns as the networks call it - early, while they're still voting on the West Coast. At least this time most of the votes have been cast, you think, unlike poor Jimmy Carter in 1980. Landslide, they call it - the type they reserve for seismic shifts, the type no President wants to hear. You watch on the big screen as ${opponent_name} struts onto stage like a performer, while the crowd chants "${opponent_slogan} ${opponent_slogan}" You can already hear what's coming: a government ran by billionaires and bigots, social programs gutted and sold off. They're not hiding it - they're proud of it.

` } } else if (!opponent_maga) { if (quickstats[0]>200) { ending=`

The White House air tastes like burnt coffee - the smell hangs heavy in your lungs, mixing with the smell of sweat from your team - staffers, cabinet officials, and Jane at your side. You resist the urge to bite your nails as the map begins to fill in - agonizingly slow. The early calls are expected - the GOP sweeping Indiana, Kentucky, and South Carolina, even as you answer back with your native Vermont. It's the wait for the drip, drip, drip of the swing states that's truly harrowing.

There's no magical moment in which you realize that things have gone wrong; that would be too easy. Counties bleeding redder than you expected as election-day votes replace absentees, just a tad bit too red. Vote tallies completing, with the final result showing turnout down, significantly so, from your last election. When the election is called for ${opponent_last_name}, when he delivers a victory speech while a crowd chants "${opponent_slogan}", it's almost a relief. Maybe four years was enough, you think, but you don't really believe it. You know what's coming - the vulgar cruelty and red-faced rants replaced by respectable cruelty in button-down suits. They'll whisper about family values and balancing the budget while gutting healthcare, nod about national security while taking funds from working families to feed the next war. But the cruelty remains the same - always the same. You remember the Bush years - the millions thrown in poverty while bankers laughed to the bank, the coffins and lies from Iraq. At least Trump pretended to be against the establishment. These people are the establishment.

` } else { ending=`

The White House air feels different tonight, the walls pressing in. You sit at the table, Jane's hand in years - the only constant thing in a room that leaves you feeling unmoored. All around you your people - staffers and Cabinet members - stare at the spreading red on the screen like spectators watching a slow-motion car crash. No one speaks a word. What is there to say?

You'd known the polls looked bad - you told your people not to waste time on unskewing, not to pretend otherwise. But still, there'd been energy, the kind that doesn't show up in spreadsheets. Your supporters swore it was close, they talked up how the polls had missed you before - remember Michigan in 2016? You'd let yourself believe, if only for a moment, if only to keep up the fight.

But the map tells a different story, the crimson tide washing like blood across the nation. States fell like dominos, some that you expected, others that leave you feeling stunned and hollow. You feel it in your gut - this isn't just a loss, it's a rebuke. America has seen you and rejected everything you'd fought for. Medicare for All, the Green New Deal, public college, a living wage - all of it gone, all of it replaced by a line of fancy suits preaching austerity with a smile.

You shake your head in disgust, remembering the normalcy and sanity of the Bush years. U.S. Interfered in Alberta Independence Vote, CSIS Report Reveals

OTTAWA — A sweeping investigation by the Canadian Security Intelligence Service (CSIS) has concluded that the United States government under President Donald Trump engaged in a covert online disinformation campaign to bolster the “Yes” side during Alberta’s recent independence referendum — a vote that ultimately rejected secession from Canada.

The classified report, portions of which were shared with senior government officials, outlines a “highly coordinated digital influence effort” traced to U.S.-based actors linked to federal agencies and proxies. The operation, CSIS alleges, aimed to amplify pro-independence sentiment among Albertans, sow distrust in federal institutions, and destabilize Canada during a period of heightened economic and political tension.

The June 2026 referendum saw 42 percent of Albertans voting to leave Confederation, underperforming polls that showed a dead heat. Premier Danielle Smith, who actively campaigned for independence, hailed the results as a “clear sign that Ottawa must listen.” The “No” side, led by a cross-partisan coalition including former premiers Rachel Notley and Jason Kenney, as well as federal Conservative Leader and Leader of the Opposition Pierre Poilievre and former prime minister Stephen Harper, ultimately prevailed with 58 per cent of the vote.

Prime Minister Mark Carney called the CSIS findings “deeply troubling” and has ordered an expanded inquiry. “Canada will not tolerate foreign interference in our democratic processes,” Carney said during a press conference Monday. “We will pursue every avenue to get to the bottom of this.”

The CSIS report also reveals that David Parker, leader of the influential “Take Back Alberta” movement and a key proponent of the “Yes” campaign, travelled to Washington in late 2025 and held a previously undisclosed meeting with U.S. Vice-President J.D. Vance. While the purpose of the meeting remains unclear, intelligence officials flagged the encounter as part of a broader pattern of “unusual and concerning contacts.”

The White House has denied the allegations. In a statement issued Tuesday morning, Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt called the claims “categorically false” and accused Ottawa of using “unsubstantiated accusations to distract from internal divisions,” offering that “perhaps they would be better off as our cherished 51st state.”

The revelations come amid escalating tensions between the two countries, already embroiled in a bruising trade war marked by tariffs on energy exports, retaliatory measures on Canadian agricultural goods, and a rise in antagonism on both sides of the border.

Political analysts say the CSIS report is likely to inflame partisan divides within Alberta and complicate an already fraught relationship between Edmonton and Ottawa. Premier Smith has not commented directly on the allegations but reiterated her belief that Albertans “deserve a fair deal in Confederation.”

The opposition in Edmonton is already calling for public hearings and greater transparency. “This is a five-alarm fire for Canadian democracy,” said Alberta NDP Leader Naheed Nenshi. “Foreign interference, particularly from an allied nation, cannot be brushed aside. We need to immediately hear from Premier Smith about what she knew and when.”

The House of Commons national security committee is expected to hold emergency sessions later this week to assess the scope of the alleged interference and recommend safeguards ahead of future provincial and federal elections.

• Ottawa Eyes Foreign Agent Registry Following Alberta Interference Report

The unrest was triggered by the abrupt firing of over 50,000 employees at the Social Security Administration and Centers for Medicare Services as part of a sweeping overhaul by the Department of Governmental Efficiency under Elon Musk, causing a cessation of benefit payments that sparked panic and fury among retirees. "We will not allow rebellion or insurrection to destroy our cities or threaten the rule of law like in 2020", Hawley proclaimed in a national address. "I will not allow mob rule to dictate policy."

In an unprecedented move, Governor Gavin Newsom of California announced that his state would refuse to comply with the federalization order, declaring it "unjustified and wholly unconstitutional." Legal scholars warn the confrontation constitutes the most serious constitutional conflict between federal and state governments since the Nullification Crisis. "We are in wholly uncharted waters", one constitutional scholar declared. "This is no longer a policy crisis - it is a test of the federal union itself."

Without access to American precision munitions, the IDF was forced to rely heavily on indiscriminate artillery bombardment, a tactic that proved both diplomatically costly and logistically unsustainable. Military analysts say that a growing shortage of artillery shells and a growing manpower crisis made the war increasingly untenable.

Sources close to the Israeli cabinet who spoke on the condition of anonymity indicate that the prospect of conscripting ultra-Orthodox Jews - as ordered by the Israeli Supreme Court in June - constituted a breaking point. Only 5% of eligible Haredi draftees responded to conscription orders, and enforcing the draft risked collapsing Netanyahu's fragile coalition, which relies upon support from Haredi parties Shas and United Torah Judaism to maintain a majority in the Knesset. In Israeli politics, Itamar Ben-Gvir resigned from Netanyahu's cabinet in protest over the Gaza ceasefire deal. Meanwhile, senior Hamas official Khalil al-Hayya released a statement from Doha, Qatar declaring victory and honoring the "heroic martyrs of Gaza." According to al-Hayya, "the liberation of Gaza is only the beginning - Hamas will continue our struggle until the establishment of the Palestinian state on all Palestinian soil, from the river to the sea, with Jersualem as its capital."


Ending Slide #30 `) e.executable.push([2, (() => {e.image = e.image = 'https://i.imgur.com/B5dDufK.jpeg'})]) } else if (e.final_overall_results.find(p=>p.candidate==300).electoral_votes>269 && ukraine_strength>=24) { //Ukraine saved e.pages.push(`

Birth registeries show that the trend began in 2022, but surged following the liberation of Crimea in late 2023 and the landmark peace treaty of late 2024 that secured Ukraine's borders and brought it into NATO and the European Union. What began as a trickle has became a generational statement of gratitude and hope.

In the heart of Kyiv, a 12-ft bronze statue of a heroically posed Bernie Sanders - depicted mid-speech, fist raised as he gazes northeast towards the Russian border - has become both a tourist attraction and a campus ritual. American politician's land acknowledgment sparks international incident in Kosovo

Vushtrri, Kosovo - March 12, 2028

A minor American politician sparked outrage, violent clashes, and an international incident this Monday after delivering a controversial land acknowledgment in Kosovo, describing the territory as "land that was taken from the Serbian people."

Elliot Morrow, a first-term city councilman for Norwalk, Iowa elected in 2027, was visiting Vushtrri, Kosovo as part of a sister city celebration intended to increase cultural and economic cooperation between the two cities.

During a scheduled speech at the Kosovo Centre for Public Safety Education and Development to open the event, Morrow began his intended remarks by stating:

"Before I begin, I want to acknowledge that we are gathered today on land with centuries of deep cultural and historical significance to the Serbian people, land that was taken from the Serbian people through ethnic cleansing and forced expulsion and never rightfully returned."

As soon as the visibly uncomfortable interpreter finished translating Morrow's statement, the reaction in the auditorium was immediate and visceral. Boos erupted. Several audience members began shouting, and one threw an unidentified bottle at the stage. Within moments, security staff attempted to escort Morrow out as a crowd of onlookers surged forward, some singing the Albanian national anthem and chanting "Kosova është Shqipëri!" ("Kosovo is Albania!") A scuffle broke out as Morrow was rushed into a nearby vehicle pursued by members of the audience.

Local media described the incident as "blatantly ignorant", while the mayor of Vushtrri threatened to terminate the sister city relationship with Norwalk if an official apology was not received. Kosovo Prime Minister Albin Kurti issued a statement calling the remarks "deeply offensive and historically ignorant."

"Kosovo is not stolen land. Kosovo is our home, our history, and the heart of our struggle for self-determination," Prime Minister Kurti said. "We welcome dialogue with our American friends, but not with those who seek to rewrite our history."

In Serbia, reporters at state-owned Radio Television of Serbia lauded the acknowledgment, calling it "the first honest words spoken by an American official about Kosovo." Several Serbian parliamentary members posted on X calling for the government to invite Morrow for a state visit.

Morrow later released a short statement after returning to the United States: "My intention was to honor all victims of displacement and colonialism in the Balkans, including both the roughly 100,000 Serbs who were forced to permanently flee Kosovo in the late 1990s and in 2004, and the estimated million Kosovo Albanians who were forced to temporarily flee war in the late 1990s. I had informed the event organizers beforehand regarding my intention to conduct this land acknowledgment, and sincerely regret that my words caused pain and misunderstanding."

While Vushtrri city officials dispute Morrow's claim that he had informed them of his intent beforehand, U.S. officials who spoke to us off the record speculate that the local translator had simply not understood what Morrow meant by a 'land acknowledgment' - a term and phenomenon largely unknown outside of Australia, Canada, New Zealand, and the United States.

Several Albanian-American organizations in the U.S. have called for Morrow's resignation, along with most other members of the Norwalk city council. Among fellow progressives, the reaction was mixed: Jacobin, an American socialist magazine, praised Morrow's 'courageous stand against NATO hegemony,' while others, including members of the Congressional Progressive Caucus, distanced themselves from his remarks. A staffer close to Speaker Hakeem Jeffries told us that Morrow's remarks were "astonishingly reckless" and a "gift to the Kremlin."


Ending slide #33.`); e.executable.push([2, (() => {e.image = e.image = 'https://i.imgur.com/qiGLdFV.jpeg'})]) } else if (party_social_progressive>=6) { e.pages.push(`

American politician sparks confusion with Celtic land acknowledgment in France

Paris, France - June 14, 2028

An American politician's attempt at a land acknowledgment during an international conference in Paris has left French attendees perplexed and sparked a flurry of reactions online.

Claire Whitman, a first-term city councilwoman from Palo Alto, California elected in 2027, was part of the Democratic Socialists of America (DSA) delegation to the Forum for Peace, organized by the Progressive International. Her panel was meant to address the fight against colonialism and imperialism. However, it was her opening remarks that gathered the most attention for reasons she likely did not intend.

"Before we begin, we must first acknowledge that we gather here today on the ancestral lands of the Gauls", Whitman declared, "a Celtic people whose lands were taken by imperial conquest - first by Rome, then by Frankish invaders, and now administered by the modern French state. This is occupied land, and we must never forget that."

The audience, comprising international delegates, responded with a moment of silence, followed by murmurs of confusion. While some American delegates offered polite applause, the rest of the audience exchanged puzzled glances. One activist from the French labor NGO ReAct Transnational was overheard asking "Does she want Paris to be returned to Astérix and Obélix?"

Attendees from France and across Europe were quick to express confusion at Whitman's remarks and framing. "It was deeply unexpected", said Élisabeth Marchand, a reporter at the French investigative newspaper Mediapart who was in attendance at the event. "While it may be technically accurate that the Gauls were here before the Franks, most of us do not consider ourselves colonizers of our own ancestors. France is a continuous cultural tapestry - not an occupation."

Others were more blunt. "It felt like she was reading from a script meant for elsewhere", said Abisai Haufiku, an activist with the Namibian Landless People's Movement attending the forum. "There are important decolonial conversations to be had about the French continuing presence in Africa, but conflating ancient history with present-day power structures is not the way to do it."

Still, a few applauded her efforts. "While clumsy, it is admirable for her to try and apply decolonial thinking globally", commented Claire Penven, a Breton activist. "Most people don't think of Celtic history as living history, but it stirred a conversation we rarely had about the erasure of minority cultures within France. Breton, the last Celtic language spoken on the European mainland, is classified by UNESCO as severely endangered, while the French government refuses to even acknowledge its existence."

In the days since, the response online has been swift. Local detractors of Ms. Whitman in Palo Alto dubbed her the "City Councilwoman for Gaul", while a popular meme on French social media superimposed her face onto a scene from the Astérix and Obélix animated series. Meanwhile, supporters rallied behind her with the #CelticJustice hashtag, which briefly trended on Bluesky, attracting attention from Irish users and fans of the Scottish football club Celtic F.C.

Whitman defended her comments on her Bluesky account, stating, "Land acknowledgment isn't just an American issue. Empire is empire - Roman or neoliberal alike. The Celts resisted Rome. We must resist imperialism today." While the DSA refused comment on the incident, a staffer speaking anonymously characterized Ms. Whitman's remarks as "a mistake" and "a distraction", saying "we probably should have workshopped it first."

Forum organizers have removed Ms. Whitman's acknowledgment from the official transcript, though the recording of her panel remains available in full online.

Both legislature only if modified polling less than -16% //1102 - Arizona: Only if modified polling less than -5% (the SoS may be a D.) 1103, //Arkansas //1104 - California: Never //1105 - Colorado: Never //1106 - CT: Never 1108, //Florida //1109 - GA: only in Red wave //1110 - HI: Never 1111, //ID //1112 - IL: Never 1113, //IN //1115 - KS - if modified polling less than -16% //1116 - Andy Beshear always wins re-election so I don't have to check whether he should be a Kamala option. 1117, //LA //1118 - Maine (and districts) - never //1119 - MD: Never //1120 - MA: Never //1121 - MI: Requires losing by 10% or more //1122 - MN - never because I need Walz to always win re-election to be a Kamala option //1123 - MS - Brandon Presley could theoretically win 1124, //MO 1125, //MT //1127 - NV - if losing by 6% or more //1128 - NH - never, Sununu too moderate to go along //1129 - NJ - never //1130 - NM - never because state senate not up in 2022 //1131 - NY - never //1132 - NC - Roy Cooper never goes along 1133, //ND //1134 - OH - if red wave gets primaried or intimidated 1135, //OK //1136 - OR: Never //1137 - never - Josh Shapiro needs to be available //1138 - RI: Never 1139, //SC 1140, //SD 1141, //TN 1142, //TX 1143, //UT //1144 - VT lol never //1145 - VA - depends on 2023 election and 2021 election //1146 - WA never //1147 - DC never 1148, //WV //1149 - WI - if losing by modified 3% or more, Tony Evers is gone (and the D SoS too.) 1150, //WY ] //WI is probably the deciding factor, with a pocket NE-02. var bernie_turnout_effect=[ 20831, 4458, 21604, 11516, 276676, 27469, 18270, 2402, 88883, 7213, 9489, 1896, 79030, 29252, 13662, 13518, 20031, 27988, 4104, 19493, 39238, 23304, 23501, 17064, 22616, 3969, 6600, 1134, 3211, 57070, 6026, 91114, 18265, 1726, 53708, 9537, 28325, 32648, 3783, 12759, 2099, 18723, 65750, 9596, 2175, 24280, 42751, 4074, 8350, 8823, 2560 ] //Every question is *roughly* a month (2023 is compressed, 2024 is stretched, but this is approximate.) Take real-world inflation numbers, add what effects you get in this mod, and this is the month-to-month change. If you do exactly what Biden did, you get the real-world inflation numbers each month (which may not line up with events in the mod, but catches up by the end.) Generally, this involves a gradual increase of inflation through mid-2022, then going down gradually afterwards. Of course, the player and Fed will be doing things too... const natural_inflation = { //Technically this is based on "inflation for the last 12 months" and so smoothed, but the inflation numbers are already plenty noisy without taking that out. It's not a giant change to the cumulative inflation numbers either. 1: 0.3, 2: 0.4, 3: 1.6, 4: 0.8, 5: 0.45, 6: -0.95, 7: -0.6, 8: -0.4, 9: 0.3, 10: 0.6, 11: -0.3, 12: 0, 13: 0.05, 14: 0.5, 15: -0.05, 16: 0.45, 17: 0.8, 18: 0.2, 19: 0.1, 20: 0.3, 21: -0.1, 22: -0.2, 23: 0.3, 24: 0.1, 25: -0.2, 26: -0.8, 27: 0.1, 28: -0.7, 29: -0.8, 30: 0.15, 31: 0.45, 32: 0.2, 33: -0.3, 34: -0.15, 35: 0.25, 36: -0.35, 37: 0.05, 38: 0.25, 39: -0.15, 40: -0.15, 41: -0.35, 42: -0.15, 43: -0.45, 44: -0.15 } const authenticity_effects = { //basically, What Would Bernie Do? "Doug Burgum" : "Marco Rubio", "Robert F. Kennedy Jr." : "Tony Robbins", "Dean Phillips" : "Benjamin Chavis", "Jill Stein" : "Delilah Barrios", } function onGameWindowChangeCandidates() { const resultsTableHolder = document.getElementById("overall_details_container"); if(!resultsTableHolder || resultsTableHolder.classList.contains("done")) { return; } resultsTableHolder.classList.add("done"); const resultsTable = resultsTableHolder.childNodes[3].childNodes[3].children[0]; for(let i = 0; i < resultsTable.children.length; i++) { const row = resultsTable.children[i]; let name = row.firstChild.innerText; row.insertCell(1); if(name) { name = name.replaceAll("-", "").trim(); console.log("name is:" + name) } if(i == 0) { if (NuclearWar==0) { row.children[1].innerHTML = `Running Mate`; } else { row.children[1].innerHTML = `Founding Saint`; } } else { row.children[1].innerHTML = vpTable[name]; } } const resultsTableHistorical = resultsTableHolder.childNodes[5].childNodes[3].children[0]; for(let i = 0; i < resultsTableHistorical.children.length; i++) { const row = resultsTableHistorical.children[i]; let name = row.childNodes[1].innerText; row.insertCell(1); if(name) { name = name.replaceAll("-", "").trim(); } if(i == 0) { row.children[1].innerHTML = `Running Mate`; } else { row.children[1].innerHTML = vpTableHistorical[name]; } } } const gameWindowNode = document.getElementById("game_window"); const candidateWatcherConfig = { attributes: true, childList: true, subtree: true }; const candidateObserver = new MutationObserver(onGameWindowChangeCandidates); candidateObserver.observe(gameWindowNode, candidateWatcherConfig); function checkInput() { if (campaignTrail_temp.question_number == 0) { if (inputString.toLowerCase() === 'biden' && !ending_2020) { e.global_parameter_json[0].fields.global_variance=0 e.global_parameter_json[0].fields.state_variance=0 e.difficulty_level_id=4 //force difficulty to normal e.difficulty_level_multiplier=0.97 //turn off any difficulty effects e.global_parameter_json[0].fields.question_count=1 ending_2020=true e.questions_json[campaignTrail_temp.question_number] = tunnel(2020); campaignTrail_temp.candidate_image_url = "https://i.imgur.com/KAdhQod.jpeg"; //Biden picture e.election_json[0].fields.advisor_url="https://i.imgur.com/tJZlkSa.jpeg" e.candidate_issue_score_json[0].fields.issue_score=0.1 //Biden perceived as economic moderate e.candidate_issue_score_json[1].fields.issue_score=0.4 //Biden perceived as globalist e.candidate_issue_score_json[2].fields.issue_score=0.4 e.candidate_issue_score_json[3].fields.issue_score=0.4 applyBernieEffect(-1*bernie_effect) //wipe out Bernie's effect on the election applyDrift(300,0.04,1107) //Biden effect in Delaware // no other election changes necessary. This should give the real-world 2020 election map - not 100% precise but close enough for me to be happy with my issue score setup. //I refuse to try and replace 3rd-party votes by state. But national tallies are actually pretty good. evs_2020=[ 9, 3, 11, 6, 55, 9, 7, 3, 29, 16, 4, 4, 20, 11, 6, 6, 8, 8, 2, 10, 11, 16, 10, 6, 10, 3, 2, 6, 4, 14, 5, 29, 15, 3, 18, 7, 7, 20, 4, 9, 3, 11, 38, 6, 3, 13, 12, 3, 5, 10, 3, ] pv_2020=[ 2323282, 359530, 3387326, 1219069, 17501380, 3256980, 1823857, 504346, 11067456, 4999960, 574469, 867934, 6033744, 3033210, 1690871, 1373986, 2136768, 2148062, 819461, 3037030, 3631402, 5539302, 3277171, 1313759, 3025962, 603674, 956383, 1405376, 806205, 4549457, 923965, 8616861, 5524804, 362024, 5922202, 1560699, 2374321, 6936976, 517757, 2513329, 422609, 3053851, 11315056, 1488289, 367428, 4460524, 4087631, 344356, 794731, 3298041, 276765 ] for (let StateNum = 0; StateNum<51; StateNum++ ) { //stop before getting to ME-01 through NE-03 e.states_json[StateNum].fields.electoral_votes=evs_2020[StateNum] e.states_json[StateNum].fields.popular_votes=pv_2020[StateNum] } //try to make states call vaguely in real-world order in case the player actually watches through it. Unfortunately, this doesn't seem to be working quite right. e.states_json[8].poll_closing_time=420 //Florida e.states_json[42].poll_closing_time=460 //TX e.states_json[18].poll_closing_time=450 //Maine e.states_json[18].poll_closing_time=460 //ME-02 e.states_json[49].poll_closing_time=500 //WI e.states_json[21].poll_closing_time=600 //MI e.states_json[37].poll_closing_time=900 //PA - doesn't work for some reason. Oh well. e.candidate_json[0].fields.first_name="Joe" e.candidate_json[0].fields.last_name="Biden" vpTable["Joe Biden"]="Kamala Harris" e.candidate_json[0].fields.state='Delaware' e.candidate_json[2].fields.first_name="Donald" e.candidate_json[2].fields.last_name="Trump" vpTable["Donald Trump"]="Mike Pence" e.candidate_json[3].fields.first_name="" e.candidate_json[3].fields.last_name="Other" vpTable["Other"]="Other" e.candidate_json[4].fields.first_name="Howie" e.candidate_json[4].fields.last_name="Hawkins" vpTable["Howie Hawkins"]="Angela Nicole Walker" e.candidate_json[5].fields.first_name="Jo" e.candidate_json[5].fields.last_name="Jorgensen" vpTable["Jo Jorgensen"]="Spike Cohen" const popup = document.getElementById("simplePopup");//turn off popup if (!popup) { } else { popup.style.display="none"; } document.head.lastElementChild.innerHTML=` #campaign_sign { background-image: url("https://files.catbox.moe/kjx20b.jpg"); background-size: cover; border-color: #c9c9c9; border-width: .01em; margin: 0 auto; background-position: center; width: 100%; height: 90px; margin-left: -0.07em; } `; //throwing together a Biden theme; this should not be complicated nct_stuff.themes[nct_stuff.selectedTheme].coloring_title = "#FF343F"; nct_stuff.themes[nct_stuff.selectedTheme].coloring_window = "#007DFF"; document.getElementsByClassName("game_header")[0].style.backgroundColor = nct_stuff.themes[nct_stuff.selectedTheme].coloring_title; $("#game_window")[0].style.backgroundColor = nct_stuff.themes[nct_stuff.selectedTheme].coloring_window; $(".container")[0].style.backgroundColor = "#003D8D "; //campaign sign color themes $("#game_window")[0].style.backgroundImage = "" //don't have backgrounds for game window and map image anymore document.getElementById("map_image").innerHTML=``; $("#game_window")[0].style.borderColor = "#FFFFFF" $(".container")[0].style.border = ".2em solid #FFFFFF" document.getElementById("header").src = "https://files.catbox.moe/205m8b.jpg"; //no tinted filters. Effect should be akin to the player waking up from a dream document.body.background = "https://i.imgur.com/ychpvyD.jpeg"; const BidenPlaylist = new Playlist(); const BidenSong = new Song("We Take Care Of Our Own", "Bruce Springsteen", "https://files.catbox.moe/qc29w1.jpg", "https://audio.jukehost.co.uk/lnZTwQg1IzWonBMItYXSbO14YSVOPoi6"); BidenPlaylist.addSong(BidenSong); changePlaylist(BidenPlaylist); quotes = ["''That’s no malarkey, That's a fact.'' ~ Joe Biden", ] customquote = quotes[Math.floor((Math.random() * quotes.length))] corrr=`\n

OUR JOE BIDEN

`+customquote+`` //view does not automatically update - to force update, force it to go to campaign map and back (trick from 2024-DM.) const viewElectoralMapButton = document.getElementById("view_electoral_map"); if (viewElectoralMapButton) { // Click the 'View Electoral Map' button viewElectoralMapButton.click(); console.log("Clicked on 'View Electoral Map' button."); // Observe changes in the DOM to react when 'Resume Questions' button becomes available const observer = new MutationObserver(mutations => { mutations.forEach(mutation => { const resumeQuestionsButton = document.getElementById("resume_questions_button"); if (resumeQuestionsButton) { // Click the 'Resume Questions' button if found resumeQuestionsButton.click(); console.log("Clicked on 'Resume Questions' button."); observer.disconnect(); // Disconnect the observer once the button is clicked } }); }); // Start observing changes in the DOM observer.observe(document.body, { childList: true, subtree: true }); } } } if (inputString.toLowerCase() === 'kamala' && ticket_status==1 && NuclearWar==0 && music=='bernie' && !ending_2020) { if (!kmusic_seen) { window.alert(`To your shock and surprise, Kamala walks in with a boom box. "What's this?", you ask. "Your taste in music is shit", she says bluntly. "Try this instead." Curious, you decide to give it a listen...`) kmusic_seen=true } else { window.alert(`You're feeling a little curious today. Maybe you outta give Kamala's music another listen...`) } changePlaylist(KPlaylist); music='kamala' } else if (inputString.toLowerCase() === 'bernie' && ticket_status==1 && NuclearWar==0 && music=='kamala' && !ending_2020) { window.alert(`You shake your head in disgust. It's Kamala's taste in music that's shit, not yours. Back to what you know...`) changePlaylist(Bplaylist); music='bernie' } inputString='' //reset after processing } document.addEventListener('keydown', function(event) { if (event.key === 'Enter') { // Check the input when Enter is pressed checkInput(); } else if (event.key.length === 1 && inputString.length < 7) { // Append the typed key to the input string inputString += event.key; } else if (event.key.length === 1 && inputString.length === 7) { // If the input string has reached 7 characters, reset it inputString = event.key; } }); function tunnel(new_q) { return e.questions_json[e.questions_json.map(f => f.pk).indexOf(new_q)]; } function applyDrift(candidateId, driftAmount, stateId) { // Loop through each object in the JSON array campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.forEach((item) => { // Check if the candidate ID matches the given candidate if (item.fields.candidate === candidateId) { // If stateId is undefined or empty, apply drift to all states for that candidate if (stateId === undefined || stateId.length === 0) { item.fields.state_multiplier += driftAmount; item.fields.state_multiplier = Math.max(0, item.fields.state_multiplier); // Ensure the multiplier never goes below 0 } else { // If stateId is an array, loop through it if (Array.isArray(stateId)) { if (stateId.includes(item.fields.state)) { item.fields.state_multiplier += driftAmount; item.fields.state_multiplier = Math.max(0, item.fields.state_multiplier); // Ensure the multiplier never goes below 0 } } else { // If stateId is a single value, just check it if (item.fields.state === stateId) { item.fields.state_multiplier += driftAmount; item.fields.state_multiplier = Math.max(0, item.fields.state_multiplier); // Ensure the multiplier never goes below 0 } } } } }); } function applyMultiplier(candidateId, multiplier, StateId) { //while Nina's drift logic is useful, it isn't a precise multiplier - it has more of an impact where the state multiplier is smaller and vice versa when larger. if (StateId === undefined || StateId.length === 0) { //applies everywhere for (let StateNum = 1100; StateNum<1156; StateNum++ ) { current_multiplier=e.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==StateNum&& p.fields.candidate==candidateId).fields.state_multiplier applyDrift(candidateId,current_multiplier*multiplier,StateNum) //apply that multiplier in that state. } } else { current_multiplier=e.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==StateId&& p.fields.candidate==candidateId).fields.state_multiplier applyDrift(candidateId,current_multiplier*multiplier,StateId) //apply that multiplier in that state. } } function applyMinorBoost(candidateId, boostAmount,stateId) { //works on 3rd party candidates while also tracking the general numbers of the boost given in each state (so as to. if (candidateId==302) { ceiling=0.5 } else if (candidateId==305) { ceiling=0.4 } else if (candidateId==303) { ceiling=0.3 //lol, if you get a Green candidate here something's gone wrong. } else { return; //will break otherwise } campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.forEach((item) => { // Check if the candidate ID matches the given candidate if (item.fields.candidate === candidateId) { // If stateId is undefined or empty, apply drift to all states for that candidate if (stateId === undefined || stateId.length === 0) { if(boostAmount>0) { //make sure it doesn't go over the max multiplier mod localboost=Math.min(ceiling-boost_list[candidateId][item.fields.state-1100],boostAmount) } else { //make sure it doesn't go under 0 localboost=Math.max(-1*boost_list[candidateId][item.fields.state-1100],boostAmount) } boost_list[candidateId][item.fields.state-1100]+=localboost; item.fields.state_multiplier += localboost; if(candidateId==302) { campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==301).fields.state_multiplier-=localboost*rfk_factor campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==301).fields.state_multiplier = Math.max(0, campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==301).fields.state_multiplier); rfk_boost+=localboost/56 } else if (candidateId==303) { campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==300).fields.state_multiplier-=localboost*green_factor campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==300).fields.state_multiplier = Math.max(0, campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==300).fields.state_multiplier); green_boost+=localboost/56 } else if (candidateId==305){ campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==300).fields.state_multiplier-=localboost*centrist_factor campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==300).fields.state_multiplier = Math.max(0, campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==300).fields.state_multiplier); centrist_boost+=localboost/56 } item.fields.state_multiplier = Math.max(0, item.fields.state_multiplier); // Ensure the multiplier never goes below 0 } else { if (item.fields.state === stateId) { if(boostAmount>0) { //make sure it doesn't go over the max multiplier mod localboost=Math.min(ceiling-boost_list[candidateId][item.fields.state-1100],boostAmount) } else { //make sure it doesn't go under 0 localboost=Math.max(-1*boost_list[candidateId][item.fields.state-1100],boostAmount) } boost_list[candidateId][item.fields.state-1100]+=localboost; item.fields.state_multiplier += localboost; if(candidateId==302) { campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==301).fields.state_multiplier-=localboost*rfk_factor campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==301).fields.state_multiplier = Math.max(0, campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==301).fields.state_multiplier); rfk_boost+=localboost/56 } else if (candidateId==303) { campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==300).fields.state_multiplier-=localboost*green_factor campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==300).fields.state_multiplier = Math.max(0, campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==300).fields.state_multiplier); green_boost+=localboost/56 } else if (candidateId==305){ campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==300).fields.state_multiplier-=localboost*centrist_factor campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==300).fields.state_multiplier = Math.max(0, campaignTrail_temp.candidate_state_multiplier_json.find(p=>p.fields.state==item.fields.state&&p.fields.candidate==300).fields.state_multiplier); centrist_boost+=localboost/56 } item.fields.state_multiplier = Math.max(0, item.fields.state_multiplier); // Ensure the multiplier never goes below 0 } } } }); } function applySalience(IssueId, driftAmount, stateId) { if (stateId === undefined || stateId.length === 0) { if (IssueId==110) { econ_salience+=driftAmount glob_salience-=driftAmount/3 soc_salience-=driftAmount/3 imm_salience-=driftAmount/3 } else if (IssueId==111) { econ_salience-=driftAmount/3 glob_salience+=driftAmount soc_salience-=driftAmount/3 imm_salience-=driftAmount/3 } else if (IssueId==112) { econ_salience-=driftAmount/3 glob_salience-=driftAmount/3 soc_salience+=driftAmount imm_salience-=driftAmount/3 } else if (IssueId==113) { econ_salience-=driftAmount/3 glob_salience-=driftAmount/3 soc_salience-=driftAmount/3 imm_salience+=driftAmount } } // Loop through each object in the JSON array campaignTrail_temp.state_issue_score_json.forEach((item) => { // Check if the issue ID matches the given issue if (item.fields.issue === IssueId) { // If stateId is undefined or empty, apply drift to all states for that issue if (stateId === undefined || stateId.length === 0) { item.fields.weight += driftAmount; item.fields.weight = Math.max(0.4, item.fields.weight); // Ensure the weight never goes below 0.4 } else { // If stateId is an array, loop through it if (Array.isArray(stateId)) { if (stateId.includes(item.fields.state)) { item.fields.weight += driftAmount; item.fields.weight = Math.max(0.4, item.fields.weight); // Ensure the weight never goes below 0.4 } } else { // If stateId is a single value, just check it if (item.fields.state === stateId) { item.fields.weight += driftAmount; item.fields.weight = Math.max(0.4, item.fields.weight); // Ensure the weight never goes below 0.4 } } } } else if ((IssueId ==110 || IssueId==111 || IssueId==112 || IssueId==113) && item.fields.issue != 114) { //Law of limited attention span means that when one issue increases in importance, others decrease in importance. Inflation - issue 114 is just special and excluded from this. // If stateId is undefined or empty, apply drift to all states for that issue if (stateId === undefined || stateId.length === 0) { item.fields.weight -= driftAmount/3; item.fields.weight = Math.max(0.4, item.fields.weight); // Ensure the multiplier never goes below 0.4 } else { // If stateId is an array, loop through it if (Array.isArray(stateId)) { if (stateId.includes(item.fields.state)) { item.fields.weight -= driftAmount/3; item.fields.weight = Math.max(0.4, item.fields.weight); // Ensure the multiplier never goes below 0.4 } } else { // If stateId is a single value, just check it if (item.fields.state === stateId) { item.fields.weight -= driftAmount/3; item.fields.weight = Math.max(0.4, item.fields.weight); // Ensure the multiplier never goes below 0.4 } } } } }); } function fadeSalience(IssueId, multiplier) { //acts as multiplier for issue weight nationwide campaignTrail_temp.state_issue_score_json.forEach((item) => { // Check if the issue ID matches the given issue if (item.fields.issue === IssueId) { item.fields.weight*=multiplier } }) } function FindImportance(IssueId) { //states go 0 to 55. StateID = statenum+1100 Importance=0 for (let StateNum = 0; StateNum<56; StateNum++ ) { if (IssueId != 114) { Importance += e.state_issue_score_json.find(p=>(p.fields.state==StateNum+1100 && p.fields.issue==IssueId)).fields.weight * e.states_json[StateNum].fields.popular_votes } else { //inflation importance stays the same; reflect increasing importance of inflation by multiplying weight by issue score difference Importance += e.state_issue_score_json.find(p=>(p.fields.state==StateNum+1100 && p.fields.issue==IssueId)).fields.weight * (1-(e.state_issue_score_json.find(p=>(p.fields.state==1100 && p.fields.issue==114)).fields.state_issue_score))*2 * e.states_json[StateNum].fields.popular_votes } } return(Importance) } function ctsAchievement(achievement){ if(campaignTrail_temp.CTS){ if (e.difficulty_level_id>=4) { unlockAchievement(achievement); } } } function applySenateChanges(ending,senate_gains,senate_losses) { //give feedback to the player on the results. if (Object.keys(senate_gains).length==0) { ending+=` Democrats failed to flip any Republican-held seats in the Senate` if (osborn_win && !Object.keys(senate_gains).includes("NE")) { //I have to guess on Osborn, and voting an R for Senate control is frankly the politically expedient option. This also simplifies things a lot. ending+=`. While Independent Dan Osborn managed to pull an upset win by ${roundToDecimals(senate_results["NE"]*100,2)}% in Nebraska, he refused to caucus with Democrats - expressing anger over ${party_econ_progressive<3 ? "the insufficiently working-class nature of the party" : party_social_progressive>5 ? "the coastal elite nature of the party, which slams him him for common-sense proposals like a border wall and gun rights" : "the overly-cautious temporizing nature of the party"} - and will vote for a Republican Majority Leader. Additionally, you` } else if(Object.keys(senate_gains).length<=2) { ending+=`, but they` } else { ending+=`, and they` } } else { ending+=` Democrats miraculously managed to flip ${Object.keys(senate_gains).length} Republican-held Senate` if (Object.keys(senate_gains).length==1) { ending+=` seat:` } else { ending+=` seats:` } Object.keys(senate_gains).forEach((item,index)=>{ if (item=="AZ") { //technically this condition checks for AZ SoS loss, not AZ governors loss (which should occur more often.) "unseated Josh Hawley" : "defeated Andrew Bailey for Hawley's former seat"} by ${roundToDecimals(senate_gains["MO"]*100,2)}% in Missouri` } else if (item=="NE") { ending+=` Dan Osborn managed to upset Deb Fischer by ${roundToDecimals(senate_gains["NE"]*100,2)}% in Nebraska and indicates that he will caucus with Democrats` } else if (item=="TX") { ending+=` Colin Allred defeated Ted Cruz by ${roundToDecimals(senate_gains["TX"]*100,2)}% in Texas` } if(Object.keys(senate_gains).length>=3 && index5 ? "the coastal elite nature of the party, which slams him for common-sense proposals like a border wall and gun rights" : "the overly-cautious temporizing nature of the party"} - and will vote for a Republican Majority Leader.` } if(Object.keys(senate_losses).length<=2) { ending+=` And you` } else { ending+=` But you` } } }); } if (Object.keys(senate_losses).length==0) { ending+=` miraculously managed to avoid losing any held seats in the Senate.` } else { if (Object.keys(senate_losses).length<=2) { ending+=` managed to limit losses in a difficult map to ${Object.keys(senate_losses).length} lost` if (Object.keys(senate_losses).length==1) { ending+=` seat:` } else { ending+=` seats:` } } else { ending+=` tragically lost ${Object.keys(senate_losses).length} seats in a very difficult map:` } Object.keys(senate_losses).forEach((item,index)=>{ if (Object.keys(senate_losses).length<8) { //adding fluff would make the list too long if 8 or more. if(item=="AZ") {//technically this condition checks for AZ SoS loss, not AZ governors loss (which should occur more often.) only ${roundToDecimals(senate_close["NV"]*100,2)}%` } else if (item=="NJ") { ending+=` Andy Kim won by only ${roundToDecimals(senate_close["NJ"]*100,2)}% in scandal-plagued Menendez's NJ open seat` } else if (item=="NM") { ending+=` Martin Heinreich barely held on by ${roundToDecimals(senate_close["NM"]*100,2)}% in New Mexico` } else if (item=="NY") { ending+=` Kirsten Gillibrand was re-elected by only ${roundToDecimals(senate_close["NY"]*100,2)}% in New York` } else if (item=="OH") { ending+=` Sherrod Brown narrowly hung on by ${roundToDecimals(senate_close["OH"]*100,2)}% in Ohio` } else if defeated Jim Justice in Manchin's open West Virginia seat by ${roundToDecimals(senate_close["WV"]*100,2)}%` } else if (item=="WI") { ending+=` Tammy Baldwin barely held on by ${roundToDecimals(senate_close["WI"]*100,2)}% in Wisconsin` } if(Object.keys(senate_close).length>=3 && indexp.pk==QuestionID).fields.description=Question } function ReplaceAnswer(AnswerID,Answer) { campaignTrail_temp.answers_json.find(p=>p.pk==AnswerID).fields.description=Answer } function ReplaceFeedback(AnswerID,Feedback) { //probably an easier way to do this... campaignTrail_temp.answer_feedback_json.find(p=>p.fields.answer==AnswerID).fields.answer_feedback=Feedback } function applyInflation(InflationAmount) { cumulative_inflation+=InflationAmount/12.0; campaignTrail_temp.state_issue_score_json.forEach((item) => { // Check if the ID is inflation if (item.fields.issue == 114) { item.fields.state_issue_score -=InflationAmount/12*(2.0/60); //annualized, and normalized such that 1 is 0% cumulative inflation and -1 is 60% cumulative inflation. } }); campaignTrail_temp.candidate_issue_score_json.forEach((item) => { //your opponents shift towards the new environment. if (item.fields.candidate !=300 && item.fields.issue ==114) { item.fields.issue_score -=InflationAmount/12.0*(2.0/60); } }); worker_approval-= InflationAmount/12.0*1/10 //each 10% cumulative inflation reduces approval by 1 latino_approval-= InflationAmount/12.0*1/10 //each 10% cumulative inflation reduces approval by 1 return; } function applyOpponent(OpponentValue) { //1 - Trump/Vance. 2 - Trump/Burgum. 3 - Trump/Rubio. 4 - Trump/Scott. 5 - Trump Jr/Ramaswamy. 6 - DeSantis/Burgum. 7 - Hawley/Vance. 11 - Vance/Trump Jr. 12 - Burgum/Trump Jr. 13 - Rubio/Trump Jr. 14 - Scott/Trump Jr. 15 - Ramaswamy/Lara Trump. 16 - Burgum/Rubio. 17 - Vance/Cotton. if(OpponentValue==1) { applySalience(113,0.15) //increases importance of immigration in the election e.candidate_json[2].fields.first_name="Donald" e.candidate_json[2].fields.last_name="Trump" vpTable["Donald Trump"]="JD Vance" //-0.1/-0.5/-0.3/-0.75 (if running in 2020: D+4.3; D+16 EVs. Tipping point PA D+4.0. House tipping point D+3.8 Senate tipping point - MT R+2.4) e.candidate_json[2].fields.state="Florida" opponent_name="Donald Trump" opponent_vp_name="JD Vance" opponent_last_name="Trump" opponent_vp_last_name="Vance" opponent_slogan="Take America Back!" e.candidate_issue_score_json[5].fields.issue_score=-0.1 e.candidate_issue_score_json[6].fields.issue_score=-0.5 e.candidate_issue_score_json[7].fields.issue_score=-0.3 e.candidate_issue_score_json[8].fields.issue_score=-0.75 //base candidate, no other variables change. applyDrift(301,0.01,1131) //NY applyDrift(301,0.01,1108) //Florida applyDrift(301,0.005,1134) //Ohio e.candidate_json[3].fields.first_name="Robert F." e.candidate_json[3].fields.last_name="Kennedy Jr." vpTable["Robert F. Kennedy Jr."]="Nicole Shanahan" vpTable["Robert F. Same shtick for globalism issue score (+1/-1 dove approval, adversary approval, -1/+1 blob approval) and immigration issue score (+1/-1 latino approval.)
