PA D+4.2; 51 Senate seats; House D+2.7; Senate tipping point MO D+1.8) e.candidate_json[2].fields.state="North Dakota" opponent_name="Doug Burgum" opponent_vp_name="Donald Trump Jr." opponent_last_name="Burgum" opponent_vp_last_name="Trump Jr." e.candidate_issue_score_json[5].fields.issue_score+=-0.2 e.candidate_issue_score_json[6].fields.issue_score+=0.7 e.candidate_issue_score_json[7].fields.issue_score+=0.1 e.candidate_issue_score_json[8].fields.issue_score+=0.35 applyMinorBoost(302,rfk_boost*0.25) //hey what happened to our MAGA candidate? //home state effects don't change. opponent_maga=false } else if(OpponentValue==13) { applySalience(112,0.075) //increases importance of social issues in the election applySalience(113,-0.075) //immigration less important worker_approval+=1.25 //ticket gets more normie on econ dove_approval+=1 //ticket moves more globalist latino_approval-=1.75 //ticket gets much more moderate on immigration adversary_approval+=1 blob_approval-=1 e.candidate_json[2].fields.first_name="Marco" e.candidate_json[2].fields.last_name="Rubio" vpTable["Marco Rubio"]="Donald Trump Jr." //-0.55/+0.4/-0.6/-0.2 (D+2.2; D+92 EVs; VA D+5, House D+4.5; 50 Senate seats - Senate tipping point AZ D+3.2%) opponent_name="Marco Rubio" opponent_vp_name="Donald Trump Jr." opponent_last_name="Rubio" opponent_vp_last_name="Trump Jr." e.candidate_issue_score_json[5].fields.issue_score-=0.25 e.candidate_issue_score_json[6].fields.issue_score+=0.2 e.candidate_issue_score_json[7].fields.issue_score+=-0.1 e.candidate_issue_score_json[8].fields.issue_score+=0.35 //home state effects don't change. opponent_maga=false } else if(OpponentValue==14) { worker_approval+=1.25 //ticket moves to right on econ dove_approval+=1 //ticket moves more globalist latino_approval-=1 //ticket gets more moderate on immigration adversary_approval+=1 blob_approval-=1 e.candidate_json[2].fields.first_name="Tim" e.candidate_json[2].fields.last_name="Scott" vpTable["Tim Scott"]="Donald Trump Jr." //-0.4/+0.3/-0.6/-0.5 (D+3.6; D+92 EVs; PA D+5.82; House D+2.4; Senate tipping point AZ R+0.9) e.candidate_json[2].fields.state="South Carolina" opponent_name="Tim Scott" opponent_vp_name="Donald Trump Jr." opponent_last_name="Scott" opponent_vp_last_name="Trump Jr." e.candidate_issue_score_json[5].fields.issue_score+=-0.25 e.candidate_issue_score_json[6].fields.issue_score+=0.2 e.candidate_issue_score_json[7].fields.issue_score+=-0.1 e.candidate_issue_score_json[8].fields.issue_score+=0.2 applyMinorBoost(302,rfk_boost*0.1) //hey what happened to our MAGA candidate? //home state effects don't change. opponent_maga=false } else if(OpponentValue==15) { worker_approval+=1.5 //ticket moves to right on econ dove_approval-=0.25 //ticket moves more isolationist latino_approval-=0.25 //ticket slightly gets more moderate on immigration e.candidate_json[2].fields.first_name="Vivek" e.candidate_json[2].fields.last_name="Ramaswamy" vpTable["Vivek Ramaswamy"]="Lara Trump" //-0.3/-0.75/-0.7/-0.55 (D+8.4; D+148 EVs; NE-02 D+10.8; House D+9.7; 50 Senate seats - Senate tipping point MT D+2.3) e.candidate_json[2].fields.state="Ohio" opponent_name="Vivek Ramaswamy" opponent_vp_name="Lara Trump" opponent_last_name="Ramaswamy" opponent_vp_last_name="Trump" e.candidate_issue_score_json[5].fields.issue_score+=-0.3 e.candidate_issue_score_json[6].fields.issue_score+=-0.05 e.candidate_issue_score_json[7].fields.issue_score+=0 e.candidate_issue_score_json[8].fields.issue_score+=0.05 //home state effects don't change. opponent_maga=true } else if(OpponentValue==16) { applySalience(112,-0.15) //decrease importance of social issues in the election applySalience(110,0.075) //increases importance of econ issues in the election applySalience(111,0.075) //increases importance of globalism in the election worker_approval+=1.5 //ticket moves to right on econ dove_approval+=1.5 //ticket moves more globalist latino_approval-=1 //ticket gets more moderate on immigration adversary_approval+=1.5 blob_approval-=1.5 e.candidate_json[2].fields.first_name="Doug" e.candidate_json[2].fields.last_name="Burgum" vpTable["Doug Burgum"]="Marco Rubio" //-0.7/+0.4/-0.3/0 (D+7.3; D+112 EVs; PA D+9.1; House D+4.3; 51 Senate seats - tipping point MO D+3.2) e.candidate_json[2].fields.state="North Dakota" opponent_name="Doug Burgum" opponent_vp_name="Marco Rubio" opponent_last_name="Burgum" opponent_vp_last_name="Rubio" e.candidate_issue_score_json[5].fields.issue_score+=-0.3 e.candidate_issue_score_json[6].fields.issue_score+=0.3 e.candidate_issue_score_json[7].fields.issue_score+=0.4 e.candidate_issue_score_json[8].fields.issue_score+=0.2 //home state effects don't change. applyMinorBoost(302,rfk_boost*0.25) //now they've gone even more establishment opponent_maga=false } else if(OpponentValue==17) { applySalience(112,-0.075) //social issues less important applySalience(113,0.075) //immigration more important worker_approval+=1.25 //ticket moves to right on econ latino_approval+=0.5 //ticket moves to right on immigration e.candidate_json[2].fields.first_name="J.D." e.candidate_json[2].fields.last_name="Vance" vpTable["J.D. Vance"]="Tom Cotton" //+0.2/-0.6/-0.4/-0.6 (D+1.3; D+14 EVs; PA D+1.0. House D+2.7; Tipping point: MT R+5.5) e.candidate_json[2].fields.state="Ohio" opponent_name="JD Vance" opponent_vp_name="Tom Cotton" opponent_last_name="Vance" opponent_vp_last_name="Cotton" e.candidate_issue_score_json[5].fields.issue_score+=-0.25 e.candidate_issue_score_json[6].fields.issue_score+=0 e.candidate_issue_score_json[7].fields.issue_score+=0.2 e.candidate_issue_score_json[8].fields.issue_score+=-0.1 applyDrift(301,-0.01,1124) //lose part of Hawley home state effect applyDrift(301,0.01,1103) //Arkansas for Cotton home state effect opponent_maga=true } if (OpponentValue>=1 && OpponentValue<=7) { //further modify ticket status; each party_unity amount boosts/hurts leftist-leaning parties by 4%; their votes come partly from you. capped_party_unity=party_unity if (party_unity>5) { capped_party_unity=5+Math.sqrt(party_unity-5) } else if (party_unity<=-5) { capped_party_unity=-5-Math.sqrt(-(5+party_unity)) } applyMinorBoost(305, -centrist_boost*capped_party_unity*0.04) if (green_boost>0) { applyMinorBoost(303, -green_boost*capped_party_unity*0.04) //usually 0 most of the time } applyDrift(300, capped_party_unity*0.0025) //additional small boost/penalty for unified/divided party. } } function roundToDecimals(n, decimals) { var log10 = n ? Math.floor(Math.log10(n)) : 0; //taking the log10 is how we find the order of magnitude of the number for the purpose of decimal places if (log10>=0) { divider=Math.pow(10, decimals); } else { //log10 is negative (i.e. number <1.) divider=Math.pow(10, decimals-(log10+1)) //believe this works properly in testing. } return Math.round(n * divider) / divider; } function applyOpponentFade() { //do this state by state. Idea is that in states when they are weak and clearly spoilers, they lose more support than states where they are clearly viable, even as just a primary opponent (where they might gain support.) for (let StateNum = 0; StateNum<56; StateNum++ ) { let pop_vote = e.current_results[1][StateNum].result DPolling = pop_vote.find(p=>p.candidate==300).percent RPolling = pop_vote.find(p=>p.candidate==301).percent IPolling = pop_vote.find(p=>p.candidate==302).percent //RFK Jr usually GPolling = pop_vote.find(p=>p.candidate==303).percent //Greens CPolling = pop_vote.find(p=>p.candidate==305).percent //Centrists if (boost_list[305][StateNum]>0) { //centrist boost in this specific state if (RPolling>CPolling*8 && DPolling>CPolling*8) { applyMinorBoost(305,-0.012*boost_list[305][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (RPolling>CPolling*4 && DPolling>CPolling*4) { applyMinorBoost(305,-0.09*boost_list[305][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (RPolling>CPolling*2 && DPolling>CPolling*2) { applyMinorBoost(305,-0.06*boost_list[305][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (RPolling>CPolling*1.5 && DPolling>CPolling*1.5) { applyMinorBoost(305,-0.03*boost_list[305][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (RPolling>CPolling && DPolling>CPolling) { applyMinorBoost(305,-0.015*boost_list[305][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (CPolling>2*RPolling || CPolling>2*DPolling) { //hard cap is naturally done already in applyMinorBoost so don't need to check here applyMinorBoost(305,0.04*boost_list[305][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (CPolling>1.5*RPolling || CPolling>1.5*DPolling) { applyMinorBoost(305,0.02*boost_list[305][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (CPolling>RPolling || CPolling>DPolling) { applyMinorBoost(305,0.01*boost_list[305][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } } if (boost_list[302][StateNum]>0) { //RFK boost in this specific state if (RPolling>IPolling*8 && DPolling>IPolling*8) { applyMinorBoost(302,-0.12*boost_list[302][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (RPolling>IPolling*4 && DPolling>IPolling*4) { applyMinorBoost(302,-0.09*boost_list[302][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (RPolling>IPolling*2 && DPolling>IPolling*2) { applyMinorBoost(302,-0.06*boost_list[302][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (RPolling>IPolling*1.5 && DPolling>IPolling*1.5) { applyMinorBoost(302,-0.03*boost_list[302][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (RPolling>IPolling && DPolling>IPolling) { applyMinorBoost(302,-0.015*boost_list[302][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (CPolling>2*RPolling || CPolling>2*DPolling) { //hard cap is naturally done already in applyMinorBoost so don't need to check here applyMinorBoost(302,0.04*boost_list[302][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (CPolling>1.5*RPolling || CPolling>1.5*DPolling) { applyMinorBoost(302,0.02*boost_list[302][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (CPolling>RPolling || CPolling>DPolling) { applyMinorBoost(302,0.01*boost_list[302][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } } if (boost_list[303][StateNum]>0) { //Green boost in this specific state if (RPolling>GPolling*32 && DPolling>GPolling*32) { applyMinorBoost(303,-0.12*boost_list[303][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (RPolling>GPolling*16 && DPolling>GPolling*16) { applyMinorBoost(303,-0.09*boost_list[303][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (RPolling>GPolling*8 && DPolling>GPolling*8) { applyMinorBoost(303,-0.06*boost_list[303][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (RPolling>GPolling*4 && DPolling>GPolling*4) { applyMinorBoost(303,-0.03*boost_list[303][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } else if (RPolling>GPolling*2 && DPolling>GPolling*2) { applyMinorBoost(303,-0.015*boost_list[303][StateNum],1100+StateNum) } } } } function applyRFKEndorse() { applyMinorBoost(302,-1) //wipe out all the boost RFK Jr has gotten e.candidate_json[3].fields.last_name+=" (suspended)" } function applyBernieEffect(value) { applyDrift(300,-0.005*value,1108) //at 10, -0.05 in Florida applyDrift(300,0.006*value,1118) //at 10, +0.06 in Maine applyDrift(300,0.022*value,1152) //at 10, +0.22 in ME-02 applyDrift(300,0.013*value,1128) //at 10, +0.13 in NH applyDrift(300,0.02*value,1144) //at 10, +0.2 in VT //turnout effect for (let StateNum = 0; StateNum<51; StateNum++ ) { //stop before ME-01 to NE-03 e.states_json[StateNum].fields.popular_votes+=bernie_turnout_effect[StateNum]*value //turn Bernie turnout into real-world 2024 turnout } } function applyKamala() { //Turns Bernie/Kamala into Kamala/??? e.candidate_json[0].fields.first_name='Kamala' e.candidate_json[0].fields.last_name='Harris' e.candidate_json[0].fields.state='California' e.candidate_json[1].fields.first_name='Temporarily' e.candidate_json[1].fields.last_name='Vacant' applyDrift(300,0.02,1104) //CA home state boost for Kamala e.election_json[0].fields.advisor_url="https://i.imgur.com/R2FmZVf.jpeg" campaignTrail_temp.candidate_image_url = "https://i.imgur.com/AvEct3B.jpeg"; campaignTrail_temp.running_mate_image_url = "https://i.imgur.com/hDLsVGF.jpeg"; //just a question mark e.candidate_issue_score_json[0].fields.issue_score=-0.3 //Kamala perceived as much more moderate and establishment on econ - exaggerating to help distinguish from Bernie's previous decisions e.candidate_issue_score_json[1].fields.issue_score=0.6 //Kamala perceived as much more globalist - exaggerating to distinguish (because the player will have previously made many important decisions that Kamala is also owning; I'm more interested in the issue movement than the actual values.) e.candidate_issue_score_json[2].fields.issue_score=0.4 //Kamala perceived as slightly more progressive on social issues and immigration e.candidate_issue_score_json[3].fields.issue_score=0.4 document.head.lastElementChild.innerHTML=` #campaign_sign { background-image: url("https://i.imgur.com/6IuwrxC.jpeg"); background-size: cover; border-color: #c9c9c9; border-width: .01em; margin: 0 auto; background-position: center; width: 100%; height: 90px; margin-left: -0.07em; } `; if (ticket_status==2) { const popup = document.getElementById("simplePopup"); popup.style.backgroundImage = "url('https://i.imgur.com/X3MtJ51.jpeg')"; //code to shift memo to VP Harris } else if (ticket_status==3) { const popup = document.getElementById("simplePopup"); popup.style.backgroundImage = "url('https://i.imgur.com/40yMWtb.jpeg')"; //code to shift memo to President Harris } //change campaign music track - defined earlier in init. changePlaylist(KPlaylist); //change Kamala theme, thanks to Skittie nct_stuff.themes[nct_stuff.selectedTheme].coloring_title = "#1f1945"; nct_stuff.themes[nct_stuff.selectedTheme].coloring_window = "#4c40aa"; document.getElementsByClassName("game_header")[0].style.backgroundColor = nct_stuff.themes[nct_stuff.selectedTheme].coloring_title; $("#game_window")[0].style.backgroundColor = nct_stuff.themes[nct_stuff.selectedTheme].coloring_window; $(".container")[0].style.backgroundColor = "#382d8d"; $("#game_window")[0].style.backgroundImage = "url(https://i.imgur.com/zKxvcC1.jpeg)" //$("#game_window")[0].style.backgroundImage = "url(https://i.imgur.com/VcTs8ci.jpeg)" $("#game_window")[0].style.borderColor = "#FFFFFF" $(".container")[0].style.border = ".2em solid #FFFFFF" document.getElementById("header").src = "https://i.imgur.com/V4JhoMQ.jpeg"; document.body.background = "https://i.imgur.com/zvp0Qtk.jpeg"; document.getElementById("map_image").innerHTML=`#map_container { background-image: url("https://i.imgur.com/pkTlUov.jpeg"); background-size: cover; }`; } function applyVP(VPnum) { if (VPnum==1) { //AOC vpTable["Kamala Harris"]="Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez" e.candidate_json[1].fields.first_name='Alexandria' e.candidate_json[1].fields.last_name='Ocasio-Cortez' e.candidate_json[1].fields.state='New York' campaignTrail_temp.running_mate_image_url = "https://i.imgur.com/J3Kc8a7.jpeg" e.running_mate_issue_score_json[0].fields.issue_score=0.7 //very economically progressive e.running_mate_issue_score_json[1].fields.issue_score=-0.2 //populist e.running_mate_issue_score_json[2].fields.issue_score=0.5 //very socially progressive too e.running_mate_issue_score_json[3].fields.issue_score=0.5 e.running_mate_state_id='1131' document.head.lastElementChild.innerHTML=` #campaign_sign { background-image: url("https://i.imgur.com/wCTCBRD.jpeg"); background-size: cover; border-color: #c9c9c9; border-width: .01em; margin: 0 auto; background-position: center; width: 100%; height: 90px; margin-left: -0.07em; } `; } else if (VPnum==2) { //Walz vpTable["Kamala Harris"]="Tim Walz" e.candidate_json[1].fields.first_name='Tim' e.candidate_json[1].fields.last_name='Walz' e.candidate_json[1].fields.state='Minnesota' campaignTrail_temp.running_mate_image_url = "https://i.imgur.com/pYDwem0.jpeg" e.running_mate_issue_score_json[0].fields.issue_score=0.4 //in between progressive and establishment I guess. e.running_mate_issue_score_json[1].fields.issue_score=0.1 e.running_mate_issue_score_json[2].fields.issue_score=0.4 e.running_mate_issue_score_json[3].fields.issue_score=0.4 e.running_mate_state_id='1122' document.head.lastElementChild.innerHTML=` #campaign_sign { background-image: url("https://i.imgur.com/fE7hsMI.jpeg"); background-size: cover; border-color: #c9c9c9; border-width: .01em; margin: 0 auto; background-position: center; width: 100%; height: 90px; margin-left: -0.07em; } `; } else if (VPnum==3) { //Beshear. Note - Kelly lost in 2020, so not an option. Roy Cooper pulls out for the same real-world reason. vpTable["Kamala Harris"]="Andy Beshear" e.candidate_json[1].fields.first_name='Andy' e.candidate_json[1].fields.last_name='Beshear' e.candidate_json[1].fields.state='Kentucky' campaignTrail_temp.running_mate_image_url = "https://i.imgur.com/L8lq3d6.jpeg" e.running_mate_issue_score_json[0].fields.issue_score=0.2 //he is not actually that moderate, but he seems pretty good at appealing to rural white working class voters e.running_mate_issue_score_json[1].fields.issue_score=0 //and anti-globalism, on vibes. e.running_mate_issue_score_json[2].fields.issue_score=0.1 //same on social issues; I'm letting him go with vibes more than actual policy. e.running_mate_issue_score_json[3].fields.issue_score=0.1 e.running_mate_state_id='1116' document.head.lastElementChild.innerHTML=` #campaign_sign { background-image: url("https://i.imgur.com/7Robhf4.jpeg"); background-size: cover; border-color: #c9c9c9; border-width: .01em; margin: 0 auto; background-position: center; width: 100%; height: 90px; margin-left: -0.07em; } `; } else if (VPnum==4) { //Shapiro vpTable["Kamala Harris"]="Josh Shapiro" e.candidate_json[1].fields.first_name='Josh' e.candidate_json[1].fields.last_name='Shapiro' e.candidate_json[1].fields.state='Pennsylvania' campaignTrail_temp.running_mate_image_url = "https://i.imgur.com/PBvCd6h.jpeg" e.running_mate_issue_score_json[0].fields.issue_score=0.35 e.running_mate_issue_score_json[0].fields.issue_score=0.4 //probably the most globalist option. e.running_mate_issue_score_json[0].fields.issue_score=0.16 //probably more progressive than this on social issues, but by being strongly pro-Israel and moderate on some notable issues he seems to appear more moderate on vibes. e.running_mate_issue_score_json[0].fields.issue_score=0.16 e.running_mate_state_id='1137' document.head.lastElementChild.innerHTML=` #campaign_sign { background-image: url("https://i.imgur.com/4iMpnEo.jpeg"); background-size: cover; border-color: #c9c9c9; border-width: .01em; margin: 0 auto; background-position: center; width: 100%; height: 90px; margin-left: -0.07em; } `; } } cyoAdventure = function (a) { ans = e.player_answers[e.player_answers.length-1]; noCounter += 1; authenticity -=0.5; //Bernie checks out over time if he doesn't stay fired up. if (party_unity>5 || party_unity<-5) { //soft cap if (party_unity>5) { party_unity=Math.max(party_unity*0.9,5) } else { party_unity=Math.min(party_unity*0.9,-5) } } if (political_capital>5 || political_capital<-5) { if (political_capital>5) { political_capital=Math.max(political_capital*0.9,5) } else { political_capital=Math.min(political_capital*0.9,-5) } } if (worker_approval>6 || worker_approval<-6) { if (worker_approval>6) { worker_approval=Math.max(worker_approval*0.95,6) } else { worker_approval=Math.min(worker_approval*0.95,-6) } } if (dove_approval>6 || dove_approval<-6) { if (dove_approval>6) { dove_approval=Math.max(dove_approval*0.95,6) } else { dove_approval=Math.min(dove_approval*0.95,-6) } } if (latino_approval>6 || latino_approval<-6) { if (latino_approval>6) { latino_approval=Math.max(latino_approval*0.95,6) } else { latino_approval=Math.min(latino_approval*0.95,-6) } } if (blob_approval>10 || blob_approval<-10) { if (blob_approval>10) { blob_approval=Math.max(blob_approval*0.95,10) } else { blob_approval=Math.min(blob_approval*0.95,-10) } } if (adversary_approval>10 || adversary_approval<-10) { if (adversary_approval>10) { adversary_approval=Math.max(adversary_approval*0.95,10) } else { adversary_approval=Math.min(adversary_approval*0.95,-10) } adversary_approval*=0.95 } applyInflation(inflation); let pop_vote = e.current_results[0]; let DPolling = (pop_vote.find(p => p.pk === 300)).pvp let RPolling = (pop_vote.find(p => p.pk === 301)).pvp let IPolling = (pop_vote.find(p => p.pk === 302)).pvp //independent - i.e. RFK et al let CPolling = (pop_vote.find(p => p.pk === 305)).pvp //centrist - no labels, Forward, etc. //implement very janky quasi-Philips curve and economic effects. if (inflation <=-5 && economy >=-10) { //deflation bad economy-=-0.4; } else if ( inflation > -5 && inflation < 0.5 && economy > -5) { //possibility of Japan-style stagnation if monetary policy insufficiently permissive economy-=0.15; } if (economy >=12) { //Overheating economy-=0.1; //unsustainable inflation+=0.25; if (economy_effect<0) { //Morning in America applyDrift(300,-0.75*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.25 } else { //soft cap applyDrift(300,-0.1*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.9 } applyDrift(300,0.005); economy_effect+=0.005 } else if (economy>=10) { // inflation+=0.1; if (economy_effect<0) { //Morning in America applyDrift(300,-0.5*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.5 } else { //soft cap applyDrift(300,-0.1*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.9 } applyDrift(300,0.0025); economy_effect+=0.0025 } else if (economy>=7) { if (economy_effect<0) { //Morning in America applyDrift(300,-0.35*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.65 } else { //soft cap applyDrift(300,-0.1*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.9 } applyDrift(300,0.001); economy_effect+=0.001 } else if (economy <7 && economy >=3) { if (economy_effect<0) { //Morning in America applyDrift(300,-0.25*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.75 } if (economy_effect>3) { applyDrift(300,-0.1*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.9 } } else if (economy<3 && economy>=0 && inflation>=5) { if (economy_effect<=-0.01) { //soft cap effect, or if economic improvement.) applyDrift(300,-0.15*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.85 } else if (economy_effect>0) { applyDrift(300,-0.1*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.9 } applyDrift(300,-0.002); economy_effect+=-0.002 inflation-=0.05; } else if (economy<3 && economy>=0) { if (economy_effect<=-0.01) { //soft cap effect, or if economic improvement. applyDrift(300,-0.15*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.85 } else if (economy_effect>0) { applyDrift(300,-0.1*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.9 } applyDrift(300,-0.002); economy_effect+=-0.002 } else if (economy<0 && economy>=-5) { inflation-=0.1; if (economy_effect<=-0.02) { //soft cap effect, or if economic improvement. applyDrift(300,-0.1*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.9 } else if (economy_effect>0) { applyDrift(300,-0.25*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.75 } applyDrift(300,-0.005); economy_effect+=-0.005 } else if (economy<-5 && economy>=-10) { inflation-=0.25; if (economy_effect<=-0.04) { //soft cap effect, or if economic improvement. applyDrift(300,-0.1*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.9 } else if (economy_effect>0) { applyDrift(300,-0.5*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.5 } applyDrift(300,-0.01); economy_effect+=-0.01 } else if (economy<-10) { //you really messed up to get here. inflation-=0.5; if (economy_effect<=-0.06) { //soft cap effect applyDrift(300,-0.1*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.9 } else if (economy_effect>0) { applyDrift(300,-0.75*economy_effect) economy_effect*=0.25 } applyDrift(300,-0.02); economy_effect+=-0.02 } if (ans >=16000) { //Fed is in Wait and See mode until spring of 2022. // General philosophy: Aggressive cuts or hikes are less efficient, but also take longer to respond to crises. Overall, given sufficient time, Fed will deliver good economy with minimal inflation no matter who's in charge... it just takes much longer for some than others. And going faster will risk a serious recession that also hurts you poll-wise. if (fed_chair=="Kashkari") { //acts aggressively, goes turbo-dove or turbo-hawk to perceived crises. Volcker-esque - prefers recession to inflation. When not in crisis, acts as dove to try and improve the economy with low interest rates. if (inflation>=10) { //does not care about economy fed_status="Radical hike"; inflation-=1; economy-=2.4; } else if (inflation >=6.5 && inflation<10) { //does not care about economy fed_status="Aggressive hike"; inflation-=0.6; economy-=1.2; } else if (inflation >=2.0 && inflation<6.5) { //does not care about economy fed_status="Moderate hike"; inflation-=0.3; economy-=0.5; } else if (inflation <0.5 && economy <=-5) { fed_status="Radical cut"; inflation+=1; economy+=2.4; } else if (inflation <1.0 && economy <=0) { fed_status="Aggressive cut"; inflation+=0.5; economy+=1.4; } else if (inflation <2.0 && economy <10) { fed_status="Moderate cut"; inflation+=0.25; economy+=0.75; } else { //inflation<2, and economy>=10, so no crisis but he worries about overheating. fed_status="Waiting"; } } else if (fed_chair =="Powell" || (fed_chair=="Brainard" && fed_call =="High")) { //Hawk - Jerome Powell; also Brainard if Bernie calls for high interest rates. Aggressively fights inflation; cautiously fights economic slowdown. if (inflation>=10) { fed_status="Aggressive hike"; inflation-=0.8; economy-=1.8; } else if (inflation >=6.5 && inflation<10) { fed_status="Moderate hike"; inflation-=0.4; economy-=0.72; } else if (inflation >=3.5 && inflation<6.5) { fed_status="Cautious hike"; inflation-=0.2; economy-=0.3; } else if (inflation <2.0 && economy <=-5) { fed_status="Aggressive cut"; inflation+=0.5; economy+=1.4; } else if (inflation <3.0 && economy <=0) { fed_status="Moderate cut"; inflation+=0.25; economy+=0.75; } else if (inflation <3.5 && economy <8) { fed_status="Cautious cut"; inflation+=0.05; economy+=0.18; } else { //inflation<3.5, and economy>=8, so no crisis but he worries about overheating. fed_status="Waiting"; } } else if (fed_chair =="Clarida" || (fed_chair=="Brainard" && fed_call =="None")) { //Dove - Lael Brainard usually, or Richard Clarida. Cautiously fights inflation, aggressively fights economic slowdown, while potentially accepting high single-digit inflation. if (inflation>=10) { fed_status="Aggressive hike"; inflation-=0.6; economy-=1.2; } else if (inflation >=6.5 && inflation<10 && economy >=0) { fed_status="Moderate hike"; inflation-=0.3; economy-=0.5; } else if (inflation >=4 && inflation<6.5 && economy>=3) { fed_status="Cautious hike"; inflation-=0.1; economy-=0.12; } else if (inflation <7.5 && economy <=-5) { fed_status="Aggressive cut"; inflation+=0.75; economy+=1.93; } else if (inflation <8.5 && economy <0) { fed_status="Moderate cut"; inflation+=0.34; economy+=1; } else if (economy <0) { //recession but risking high inflation fed_status="Moderate cut"; inflation+=0.225; economy+=0.7; } else if (inflation <6.0 && economy <3) { fed_status="Moderate cut"; inflation+=0.225; economy+=0.7; } else if (economy<3) { //slow economy but inflation risking going over 6.5% fed_status="Cautious cut"; inflation+=0.15; economy+=0.5; } else if (inflation <4 && economy <=10) { fed_status="Cautious cut"; inflation+=0.15; economy+=0.5; } else { //inflation<4, and economy>=10, so no crisis but worry about overheating. fed_status="Waiting"; } } else if (fed_chair =="Brainard" && fed_call=="Low") { //Mega-dove: Lael Brainard if Bernie calls for low interest rates. Very cautiously fights inflation, very aggressively fights economic slowdown. if (inflation>=10) { fed_status="Moderate hike"; inflation-=0.4; economy-=0.72; } else if (inflation >=6.5 && inflation<10 && economy >=0) { fed_status="Cautious hike"; inflation-=0.2; economy-=0.3; } else if (inflation >=4 && inflation<6.5 && economy>=3) { fed_status="Cautious hike"; inflation-=0.05; economy-=0.05; } else if (inflation <8.5 && economy <=-5) { fed_status="Radical cut"; inflation+=1; economy+=2.4; } else if (inflation <9.0 && economy <0) { fed_status="Aggressive cut"; inflation+=0.5; economy+=1.4; } else if (economy<0) { fed_status="Moderate cut"; inflation+=0.34; economy+=1; } else if (inflation <6.0 && economy <3) { fed_status="Moderate cut"; inflation+=0.34; economy+=1; } else if (economy<3) { fed_status="Cautious cut"; inflation+=0.25; economy+=0.75; } else if (inflation <4 && economy <=10) { fed_status="Cautious cut"; inflation+=0.25; economy+=0.75; } else { //inflation<4, and economy>=10, so no crisis but worry about overheating. fed_status="Waiting"; } } } //Implement 'natural' inflation if (natural_inflation.hasOwnProperty(e.question_number+1)) { inflation += natural_inflation[e.question_number+1]; } if (authenticity_effects.hasOwnProperty(ans)) { authenticity += authenticity_effects[ans]; } //For significant economic stimulus bills, don't dump it in all at once; delay its implementation. if (stimulus>0) { if (stimulus>=12) { economy+=4 inflation+=2 stimulus-=4 } else if (stimulus>=9) { economy+=3 inflation+=1.5 stimulus-=3 } else if (stimulus>=6) { economy+=2 inflation+=1 stimulus-=2 } else if (stimulus>=1) { economy+=1 inflation+=0.5 stimulus-=1 } else { economy+=stimulus inflation+=stimulus*0.5 stimulus=0 } } if (immigration_level==3) { economy+=0.1 //mass migration is generally good for the economy and alleviates labor shortages that were serious issues immediately post-pandemic } else if (immigration_level==1) { //delayed effect of migration restrictions economy-=0.1 //lack of mass migration exacerbates post-pandemic labor shortages and is a drag on the economy. } if (ans == 1001) { expectations +=1 //interest groups require more to be satisfied now party_econ_progressive +=1 political_capital-=1 //Manchinema don't like. applySalience(110,0.06) //make nation care more about economic policy. } else if (ans == 1002) { party_unity +=1 //vaguely unifying } else if (ans == 1003) { expectations -=1 party_unity +=1 //unified against the right political_capital+=1 //Manchin likey you lowering expectations bipartisan-=1 //attacking the right } else if (ans == 1004) { expectations -=1 party_econ_progressive+=3 party_unity -=2 political_capital-=2 bipartisan-=1 adversary_approval+=1 //PRC+Russia sees you as incompetent and infighting. } else if (ans==2001) { cabinet_domestic_progressive=1 cabinet_foreign_progressive=1 inflation+=0.5 //Stop granting new oil/gas leases (Biden policy) is automatic and results eventually in constraining supply. Every answer appointing any Cabinet does this (Bernie should not have the option to have a more moderate Cabinet than Biden.) bipartisan-=1 } else if (ans==2002) { cabinet_domestic_progressive=1 cabinet_foreign_progressive=0 inflation+=0.5 party_unity+=1 //appointing a mixed cabinet is a gesture to unity (carrot for each side.) } else if (ans==2003) { cabinet_domestic_progressive=0 cabinet_foreign_progressive=1 inflation+=0.5 party_unity+=1 //appointing a mixed cabinet } else if (ans==2004) { cabinet_domestic_progressive=0 cabinet_foreign_progressive=0 inflation+=0.5 bipartisan+=1 //sort of } else if (ans==3001) { political_capital+=1 bipartisan+=1 } else if (ans==3002) { r_radical+=1 party_social_progressive+=1 if (cabinet_domestic_progressive==1) { //has an AG willing to play ball party_unity+=1 r_radical+=1 prosecute_trump=1 applySalience(111,0.06) //Increase salience of social issues and globalism as proxy for general importance of democracy. applySalience(112,0.06) //Increase salience of social issues and globalism as proxy for general importance of democracy. } } else if (ans==3003) { political_capital-=1 } else if (ans==3004) { political_capital-=1 party_unity+=1 } else if (ans==4001) { party_unity+=1 economy+=1 //faster reopening. `+customquote+`` if (worker_approval>=3+expectations*2) { e.questions_json[campaignTrail_temp.question_number+1] = tunnel(41000) party_unity+=1 party_econ_progressive+=1 } else if (worker_approval>=-3+expectations*2) { ReplaceQuestion(41100,`Most labor unions are backing you, but not as strongly as you'd hoped. How do you try and shore up their base?`) e.questions_json[campaignTrail_temp.question_number+1] = tunnel(41100) } else { e.questions_json[campaignTrail_temp.question_number+1] = tunnel(41200) party_unity-=1 party_econ_progressive-=1 } } else { if (worker_approval>=3+expectations*2) { e.questions_json[campaignTrail_temp.question_number+1] = tunnel(41300) party_unity+=1 party_econ_progressive+=1 } else if (worker_approval>=-3+expectations*2) { ReplaceQuestion(41400,`Many labor unions have backed you, but not all. What can you do?`) e.questions_json[campaignTrail_temp.question_number+1] = tunnel(41500) party_unity-=1 party_econ_progressive-=1 } } } else if (e.question_number==40) { if (ticket_status>=2) { //What would you have done differently from Bernie, Kamala? quotes = ["''What can be, unburdened by what has been'' ~ Kamala Harris", ] customquote = quotes[Math.floor((Math.random() * quotes.length))] corrr=`\n

This is in lieu for the lack of campaign visits. } else if (ending_2020) { e.player_answers=[] //2020 answer has no effect; the player may have managed to sneak in an answer by highlighting it and simultaneously answering/switching to Bernie. `+customquote+`` e.election_json[0].fields.has_visits = 0 //so you don't get an awkward visit question while everything else changes. } updateSimplePopup(); } function createSimplePopup() { const popup = document.createElement("div"); popup.id = "simplePopup"; popup.style.position = "fixed"; popup.style.bottom = "20px"; popup.style.right = "20px"; popup.style.width = "255px"; popup.style.height = "412px"; popup.style.border = "1px solid #000"; popup.style.borderRadius = "5px"; popup.style.padding = "75px 5px 5px 5px"; popup.style.boxShadow = "0 0 5px rgba(0,0,0,0.2)"; popup.style.zIndex = "10000"; popup.style.fontFamily = "'Courier New', Courier, monospace"; popup.style.fontSize = "14px"; popup.style.color = "#000"; popup.style.backgroundImage = "url('https://i.imgur.com/dfNsqPp.jpeg')"; popup.style.backgroundSize = "cover"; popup.style.backgroundRepeat = "no-repeat"; popup.style.backgroundPosition = "center"; popup.style.display = "block"; const content = document.createElement("div"); content.id = "popupContent"; content.style.pointerEvents = "auto"; popup.appendChild(content); document.body.appendChild(popup); injectTooltipStyles(); // <-- inject styles ONCE makePopupDraggable(popup); updateSimplePopup(); } function makePopupDraggable(popup) { let offsetX = 0; let offsetY = 0; let isDragging = false; popup.addEventListener("mousedown", (e) => { isDragging = true; offsetX = e.clientX - popup.getBoundingClientRect().left; offsetY = e.clientY - popup.getBoundingClientRect().top; document.addEventListener("mousemove", onMouseMove); document.addEventListener("mouseup", onMouseUp); }); function onMouseMove(e) { if (!isDragging) return; let newX = e.clientX - offsetX; let newY = e.clientY - offsetY; const maxX = window.innerWidth - popup.offsetWidth + 150; const maxY = window.innerHeight - popup.offsetHeight + 150; newX = Math.max(-50, Math.min(newX, maxX)); newY = Math.max(-50, Math.min(newY, maxY)); popup.style.left = `${newX}px`; popup.style.top = `${newY}px`; popup.style.bottom = "auto"; popup.style.right = "auto"; } function onMouseUp() { isDragging = false; document.removeEventListener("mousemove", onMouseMove); document.removeEventListener("mouseup", onMouseUp); } } function injectTooltipStyles() { if (document.getElementById("tooltipStyles") && styles_set) return; styles_set=true; document.getElementById("tooltipStyles").textContent = ` .hover-value { border-bottom: 1px dotted #000; cursor: help; position: relative; } .hover-value::after { content: attr(data-tooltip); position: absolute; background: url('https://i.imgur.com/dfNsqPp.jpeg') center/cover no-repeat; color: #000; padding: 6px 10px; font-family: 'Courier New', Courier, monospace; font-size: 13px; border: 1px solid #000; border-radius: 5px; box-shadow: 0 0 5px rgba(0,0,0,0.2); white-space: nowrap; opacity: 0; pointer-events: none; top: -32px; left: 50%; transform: translateX(-75%); z-index: 10001; transition: opacity 0.2s ease-in-out; } .hover-value:hover::after { opacity: 1; } `; //overwrite old styles from code1 } function updateSimplePopup() { const content = document.getElementById("popupContent"); if (!content) return; if (ticket_status==1) { authenticity_description=`

Fervor: =8 ? "style=\"color:#007D3E;\"" : authenticity<0 ? "style=\"color:#CC071E;\"" : ""} class="hover-value" data-tooltip="${ authenticity <= -8 ? 'Burnt out and checked out' : authenticity <= 0 ? 'Frustrated and losing hope' : authenticity <= 8 ? 'Tired but persisting' : authenticity <= 15 ? 'Hopeful and loud' : 'Fired up, ready to go' }">${authenticity.toFixed(1)}

` } else { authenticity_description=`

` EconImportance=FindImportance(110) GlobImportance=FindImportance(111) SocImportance=FindImportance(112) ImmImportance=FindImportance(113) InfImportance=FindImportance(114) TotalImportance=EconImportance+GlobImportance+SocImportance+ImmImportance+InfImportance issue_report=`

Cumulative inflation: ${cumulative_inflation.toFixed(2)}%

`+party_report+`

`+issue_report+`

` } function toggleSimplePopup() { const popup = document.getElementById("simplePopup"); if (!popup) return; popup.style.display = (popup.style.display === "none") ? "block" : "none"; } function addHeadquarterButton() { if (document.getElementById('headquarter_button')) return; const refButton = document.getElementById('view_electoral_map'); if (!refButton) return; const newButton = document.createElement('button'); newButton.id = 'headquarter_button'; newButton.style.marginLeft = '1.5em'; newButton.innerHTML = 'Game Stats'; newButton.addEventListener('click', toggleSimplePopup); refButton.insertAdjacentElement('afterend', newButton); } createSimplePopup(); async function handleFooter() { const gameWindow = document.getElementById('game_window'); addHeadquarterButton(); } let observerRunning = false; let changeChartRunning = false; let processedNodes = new Set(); async function handleMutations(mutationsList, observer) { if (observerRunning) return; observerRunning = true; observer.disconnect(); if (!ending_2020) { addHeadquarterButton(); } if (!changeChartRunning && NuclearWar>0) { changeChartRunning = true; const elementIDs = ["overall_vote_statistics", "state_result_data_summary", "overall_details_container","electoral_result_container","state_result_container"]; for(let id of elementIDs) { let element = document.getElementById(id); if (element && !processedNodes.has(element)) { let overallthing = element.innerHTML; overallthing = overallthing.replace("Electoral Votes","Dioceses"); overallthing = overallthing.replace("ELECTORAL VOTES","Dioceses"); overallthing = overallthing.replace("Candidate","Ministry"); overallthing = overallthing.replace("Popular Votes","Congregation Size"); overallthing = overallthing.replace("Popular Vote %","Adherent %"); element.innerHTML = overallthing; processedNodes.add(element); } } changeChartRunning = false; } ReadingButton=document.getElementById('recommended_reading_button') if (ReadingButton) { ReadingButton.innerHTML="Author notes on game mechanics" } observer.observe(document.documentElement, { childList: true, subtree: true }); observerRunning = false; } var element = document.getElementById('controlElement'); if (!element) { let singleObserver = new MutationObserver(handleMutations); singleObserver.observe(document.documentElement, { childList: true, subtree: true }); var controlElement = document.createElement('div'); controlElement.style.display = 'none'; controlElement.id = 'controlElement'; document.body.appendChild(controlElement); } function getTooltips(str) { let matches = []; tooltipList.forEach((tooltip, index) => { // Adjust the regex to match searchString potentially surrounded by “ and followed by optional punctuation let regex = new RegExp(`(?<=\\b|\\s|^|“)${tooltip.searchString}(?=[.,;!?]?\\b|\\s|”|$)`, 'g'); let match; while ((match = regex.exec(str)) !== null) { matches.push({ start: match.index + (match[0].startsWith('“') ? 1 : 0), // Adjust for potential starting “ end: match.index + match[0].length - (match[0].endsWith('”') ? 1 : 0) - (match[2] ? 1 : 0), tooltipIndex: index }); } }); // Sort by starting position; if two start at the same position, longer match comes first matches.sort((a, b) => a.start - b.start || b.end - b.start - (a.end - a.start)); // Filter out overlaps for (let i = 0; i < matches.length - 1; ) { if (matches[i + 1].start < matches[i].end) { matches.splice(i + 1, 1); // Remove the next match since it overlaps } else { i++; // Move to next match } } return matches; } function applyTooltips(str) { const matches = getTooltips(str); let result = ''; let lastIndex = 0; matches.forEach(match => { const tooltip = tooltipList[match.tooltipIndex]; result += str.slice(lastIndex, match.start); if (tooltip.color !=undefined) { if (['darkblue','darkred','darkgreen'].includes(tooltip.color)) { result += `${tooltip.searchString}${tooltip.explanationText}`; } else { result += `${tooltip.searchString}${tooltip.explanationText}`; } } else { result += `${tooltip.searchString}${tooltip.explanationText}`; } lastIndex = match.end; }); result += str.slice(lastIndex); // Add the remainder of the original string return result; } function applyTooltipsToObject(obj) { for (let key in obj) { if (typeof obj[key] === 'string') { obj[key] = applyTooltips(obj[key]); } else if (typeof obj[key] === 'object') { applyTooltipsToObject(obj[key]); // Recursive call } } } if (e.tooltips_on) { applyTooltipsToObject(campaignTrail_temp.questions_json); applyTooltipsToObject(campaignTrail_temp.answers_json); applyTooltipsToObject(campaignTrail_temp.answer_feedback_json); } let style = document.createElement('style'); style.type = 'text/css'; style.id = 'dynamic-style'; const customStyling = document.createElement("style"); customStyling.innerHTML = ` #campaign_sign { background-image: url("https://i.imgur.com/UyPz0vx.jpeg"); background-size: cover; border-color: #c9c9c9; border-width: .01em; margin: 0 auto; background-position: center; width: 100%; height: 90px; margin-left: -0.07em; } `; document.head.appendChild(customStyling);
